Provide day care services to the clients attending the Day Care and Dementia Care Centre, by assisting in their personal care and activities of daily living to ensure comfort and safety of the individual in accordance with the standards of St. Andrew’s Senior Care, and maintaining a clean, orderly and safe environment for the clients.

title: Female Personal Trainer
description:
WE ARE HIRING FEMALE PERSONAL TRAINERS!

Athleaders has been ranked the No. 1 Personal Training company in Singapore by expat forums and magazines.
We are looking for dynamic personal trainers who are enthusiastic, self-motivated individuals with a strong passion for sports to join our growing team.

The ideal candidate should have previous experience in personal training or group fitness classes. However, we are also open to those who are willing to learn quickly, are hard workers and most importantly have an interest in ensuring our client's health goals are achieved.

Bonus if you have experience handling female challenges such pre/post natal, menopause etc.

This role is for you if you are:

Results driven - Responsible enough to always put our clients first. Arming them with the required knowledge, motivating them and relentlessly working towards getting them to reach their goal is a MUST.
A person who has great communication and people skills – you should be able to hold a conversation on a broad range of topics.
A person with a great work ethic, willingness to adapt and learn.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Train clients (1:1 or 1: Many) in-person at their designated locations (virtual classes may occur too).
Sales will NOT be a part of the job. Ensuring our clients are armed with the best advice, encouragement and knowledge to meet their individual health targets is your main goal.
Plan individually tailored & customised programmes for each client.
Provide clear instructions and demonstrate the movement patterns of each exercise.
Guide clients to make better choices on their nutrition. Oversee their food/water intake and guide them on how it can be improved.
Any other ad-hoc duties as assigned.

BENEFITS:

Transportation allowance provided
Highly competitive salary
Loyalty payouts upto $18,000
No sales required
Life insurance and liability insurance
Base salary (Full timers)
CPF (Full timers)

REQUIREMENTS

Female.
Above 18 years of age.
Proficient and fluent in English; other language proficiencies are a bonus.
Communicate well - friendliness and openness is a must.
Prior experience working in a health & fitness company or customer facing role is a bonus.
Passion for sports.

title: Draughtsman (General)
description:
Job Title: Draughtsman
Company: Interior Design/Contractor/M&E Company in Singapore
Work Hours: Monday to Saturday, 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM

Key Responsibilities:

Visit construction sites to take measurements and assess project requirements.
Collaborate with Project Managers to ensure drawings align with construction needs.
Create detailed drawings using AutoCAD, Revit, 3ds Max, Enscape, and other relevant software.
Familiarity with Photoshop, Microsoft Office, and AI innovation tools for design enhancement.
Knowledgeable in industry standard detailing (carpentry, M&E services, finishing details, etc.)
Execute A&A (Additions and Alterations) interior and M&E (Mechanical & Electrical) works construction projects.
Demonstrate a strong attention to detail in all drafting work.
Actively participate in meetings, communicate effectively with team members, and contribute to project discussions.
Work collaboratively in diverse teams to ensure project success.
Demonstrate a fast and efficient workflow with design software.
Continuously improve design knowledge and skills.

Qualifications:

Degree in Architecture , Engineering , relevant construction fields
Proficient in AutoCAD, Revit, 3ds Max, Enscape, Photoshop, Microsoft Office, and AI innovation tools.
Strong understanding of Singapore standards, BCA regulations, and other local construction requirements.
Excellent presentation and communication skills.
Trainable and adaptable to new tools and techniques.
Good eye for detail and design aesthetics.
Capable of working efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
Willingness to visit construction sites and work on-site as needed.

Additional Information:
We are looking for a dedicated and skilled member to join our team. If you are passionate about architectural & M&E drafting, have a good eye for detail, and are capable of working collaboratively with a diverse team, we encourage you to apply for this position. Your expertise and commitment will contribute to the success of our interior design, construction, and M&E projects in Singapore.

You will be actively involved in Additions and Alterations (A&A) works across a wide range of projects, including commercial offices, laboratories, industrial facilities, and various other types of structures. Your role will contribute to the enhancement and transformation of these spaces to meet the evolving needs of our clients.

title: Staff Nurse (Nursing Home) - Perm AM/PM Shift (5 days/wk)
description:
Job Title: Staff Nurse
Location: North - Singapore
Setting: Nursing Home

Benefits & Feature:

- Attractive Bonus (AWS, PB and VB) & Basic Salary
- Career Progression & Meal Provided
- Perm Sun Off & 1 weekday Off
- Perm AM/PM Shift (5 days/week)
- Supportive Colleague and Management

Roles & Responsibilities:

As a Staff Nurse, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the well-being and safety of our residents. Your responsibilities will include:

Assisting in the analysis, planning, implementation, and review of nursing care and service delivery to residents.
Packing and serving medication and updating medication charts.
Conducting rounds to ensure residents are well and safe, and promptly reporting any abnormalities in patient disposition.
Assisting in Doctor's rounds and in treatments and examinations of residents, if applicable.
Identifying problems related to illness and declines in functional and cognitive abilities, advocating early medical attention.
Assessing residents after incidents, recommending preventive measures, and completing incident reports.
Assisting in reviewing Resident Assessment Form (RAF), Fall Risk assessments, and Restraints of resident's measures.
Maintaining accurate documentation of care as required by the Company's quality procedures and guidelines.
Participating in orientation and in-service education programs.
Supervising caregivers under your charge as required.
Participating in all activities related to the smooth running of the ward/unit.

Requirements:

To be considered for this role, you should meet the following requirements:

Diploma/Degree in Nursing.
Registered Nurse with the Singapore Nursing Board with at least 1 years of clinical experience.
Highly motivated and able to work as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
Good communication skills, pleasant personality, and strong interpersonal skills.

title: Administration Officer, Clinical Services (1 Year Contract)
description:
Job Summary
You will report to the Medical Director (MD) and Clinical Services Lead to support Clinical Operations and Service Management across various clinical disciplines and Diagnostic Imaging (DI) department.

Job Description

Assist in the management of medical manpower planning to ensure optimal staffing levels in all medical centres, including but not exhaustive: coordinating doctors’ and radiographers' rosters, and locum timesheets.
Work closely with Clinical services Lead to plan and coordinate delivery of daily tasks.
Coordinate and participate in periodic meetings, send out supporting documentation (agenda), take down and distribute meeting notes and perform any administrative follow up actions as required.
Provide oversight of medical staff professional – radiographers and doctors.
Ensure all staff working in the medical centres are certified and holds relevant certifications to practice safely.
Oversee and facilitate the smooth administration of an accreditation and credentialing programme for medical staff and for continuing medical education training and development through the establishment of various programmes.
Assist with the preparation of Department Action Plans (DAPs). You will work closely with relevant parties to facilitate the establishment of new clinical services and the expansion of existing clinical services.
Conduct regular on-site visits to medical centres for audits and briefing sessions.
Support the mapping of existing services, protocols and stakeholders within SATA CommHealth and community partners, and ensure role clarity for relevant projects and duties.
Undertake any other appropriate duties when required by Clinical Services Lead.


Job Requirements

Diploma in any discipline.
Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills.
Meticulous and detail-oriented.
A good team player who is able to work independently.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications (especially MS Excel).
Flexibility to support the department as and when required.

Interested applicants are invited to send in their detailed resumes, stating current and expected salary via APPLY NOW.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: [DTL] Senior / Engineer, Systems (Technical Support)
description:
Responsibilities

Lead and manage a team of Assistant Engineers and Senior/Technicians for the maintenance activities of DTL Communications Systems
Responsible for failure analysis and investigation of Communications Systems
Responsible for the replacement program for Communications Systems
Responsible for cost saving, improvement and upgrading work for Communications Systems
Lead, manage and support maintenance team for DTL Communications Systems to meet the required standards of safety, reliability and availability
Assist Section Head to writing maintenance and project plan, rules and procedures, safety plans and reports
Assist Section Head to achieve ISO certifications, if required
Collaborate with the contractors for the defect and modification work to ensure a smooth process
Audit of maintenance work for improvement and productivity
Study and analyze the faults and propose for improvement
Assist Section Head to monitor all modifications and upgrading of the equipment in the communications systems
Assist Section Head to manage and develop Work Instructions and Specifications for maintenance of the equipment and subsystems
Monitor and conduct regular audit on the maintenance of the equipment and process
Assist Section Head to manage and review R&P/Work Instruction periodically
Conduct investigation for incidents and delays related to Communications Systems
Ensure the competency level of the maintenance staffs
Develop, plan and conduct of in-house Communications course according to WSQ for maintenance staffs
Assess the staff’s competency after training to ensure it meets the required standards and competency for the job
Assist in planning and coordinating of new and existing staff training plan
Assist Section Head for any A&A, upgrading and project work

Requirements

Degree in Electrical / Electronics / Computer Engineering or equivalent
Knowledge in computer hardware and software applications
Able to lead a team to perform maintenance work
Can work with own initiative and independent
Able to cope with stress
Strong planning, organisation, interpersonal and communication skills
Resourceful, self-motivated and results-oriented
Must be able to differentiate colors for work purposes


We regret to inform that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

title: Bancassurance Specialist (Banking) | CODE:GL
description:
Are you an aspiring professional seeking a rewarding career in the banking and financial industry? Look no further! Join our dynamic team and embark on a journey of growth and success.

Offering:

Competitive Base Salary
No Experience: Starting at $3,500 with potential to earn up to $3,900
Experienced (former Bankers/Financial Advisers): Up to $5,000, plus a generous Sign-on Bonus
Uncapped Sales Incentives based on Quarterly Individual Sales Performance
Exceptional Career Advancement Prospects, encompassing both Sales and Non-Sales pathways, attainable within 2-3 years. Apply now to explore further details.

Why Choose Us?
By becoming a part of our team, you will enjoy the following benefits:

Comprehensive Support from the Bank, including access to a vast client database, assigned prospects/leads, regular market updates, and product training.
Ideal Environment for Professional Growth
Ideal Candidate Profile

We are seeking individuals who embody the following qualities:

Articulate, Professional, and Detail-Oriented
Sales-Driven with a strong aspiration to advance within the diverse spectrum of banking careers

Key Responsibilities
Your primary role will involve:

Offering Personal Wealth Management services by introducing and selling the Bank's Bancassurance (Insurance) product suite.
Meeting with walk-in clients, utilizing the Bank's software platform to conduct thorough fact-finding to understand their financial needs and goals.
Providing tele-advisory services to mass market and retail banking clients over the phone and scheduling consultations. You will have access to any of the Bank's branches located island-wide.

Qualifications
To be eligible for this role, you should have:

A minimum of a Local Diploma or higher
Completion of the required 4-6 CMFAS modules before commencing employment
The opportunity for module reimbursement on the first attempt, with guidance and supplementary materials provided
Availability to work 5.5 days per week (Monday to Friday and Saturday mornings)
Off-In-Lieu provided

If you are a dedicated and driven professional, we invite you to apply and explore the exciting opportunities waiting for you in our organization.

Interested candidates can kindly apply via MyCareersFuture or email your latest CV to gary.lua@jusrecruit.com.sg

title: Assistant / Operations Engineer (Media Delivery)
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Mediacorp is Singapore’s largest content creator and national media network, operating a suite of TV channels, radio stations, and multiple digital platforms. Its mission is to engage, entertain, and enrich audiences by harnessing the power of creativity.
We are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace where talent thrives. Our hiring decisions are made based on merit and fit-to-role. If you have a disability or special need which requires accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. We will be happy to support as necessary.
Thank you for your interest and application to this role. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

RESPONSIBILITIES

The Engineer shall plan and install delivery links to send the audio video feeds from the event sites to the designated location(s) by deploying suitable technologies. He is to ensure the feed received at the designated location is of broadcast quality and monitor them throughout the events. He will have to liaise with many parties such as the vendors and building owners during the work. He will also need to maintain all the delivery equipment well to ensure they are always operationally ready.
 
Responsibilities
Manage projects related to Media Delivery links.
Establish various types of Media Delivery technologies include cellular bonding technology, optical fiber link, microwave link, IP streaming, Mesh Radio link and etc.
Set up equipment at outdoor venues and ensure all power supplies requirements are adequate and appropriate for Live operations, that comply with safety regulations.
Liaise with the agencies and building owners for the approval of use of the premises.
Work over weekends public holidays and after office hours depending on the job requirements.
Perform standby duty for VIP events (e.g. breaking news, emergency events, BCP exercise and etc.)
Perform regular equipment maintenance and housekeeping.
Adhere to workplace safety and cyber security policy while performing duties.
 
QUALIFICATIONS
Higher Nitec/Diploma/Degree in Engineering or IT discipline
Minimum 1 year of relevant experience. Fresh graduates may be considered if found suitable for the position
Knowledge in digital transmission, such as COFDM, MIMO technology
Knowledge in IT networking includes Cisco Switches
Knowledge in Linux and/or Window OS
Basic Cyber Security knowledge
Basic RF knowledge will be an advantage
Certified to work at height will be an advantage
Possess a valid Class 3 driving license



    Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Mediacorp Pte. Ltd.

title: Human Resource Recruitment Executive ( Entry Level ) #HVN
description:
People are at the heart of great things at Recruit Express

The Role of a Recruiter

A Recruiter’s job is a hybrid role – it is not just about recruitment. It also encompasses business development, account management, marketing, customer service all rolled into one. It is about understanding people’s needs and motivations, and managing clients’ and candidates’ expectations. It is also about building relationships. A challenging role indeed, but a very meaningful one!

Responsibilities:

 Business Development: Initiate a range of business development and marketing activities to build new corporate clients and grow your own client portfolio.

 Account Management: Manage internal and external stakeholders and clients on their hiring needs.

 Talent Acquisition: Engage in candidate sourcing activities, such as publishing job advertisements and conducting candidate referrals, to ensure a consistent supply of candidates to meet client's needs.

 Candidate Management: Manage candidates’ job needs and expectations, their payroll and employment benefits.

Requirements:


 Minimum Degree in ANY Discipline
 Applicants with good track record in sports or other co-curricular activities in school will have an added advantage
 Strong interest in marketing and/or business development with good business acumen
 Possess enthusiasm and most importantly, passion for people

title: Web Developer & Full-Stack Coding Intern
description:
Quick Apply: You may send your Resume/CV to recruitment@singaporetuitionteachers.com or apply via MyCareersFuture.
Office Location: 28 Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Bright Hill/Marymount/Bishan MRT)
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:

MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture

Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:

Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.

Learning Outcomes & Objectives:

Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary

Requirements:

Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently

Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:

5 Days Work Week, Weekdays 9.00am - 6.30pm
Midview City (Sin Ming Lane)
Closest MRTs: Bright-Hill MRT (Door-Step), Bishan / Marymount MRT (nearby)
$1,000 - $1,200/Month
Interns will also be given several days of paid leave (depending on internship period)

Why Choose Us:

Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics!
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
Conveniently located with New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep

Application:

Submit an e-mail application with Resume/CV to mindflex.recruitment@gmail.com with Email Title "Web Developer Intern Application"
Please ensure to include the following in Email and attached documents:

1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Suitable Profile Picture of Yourself
4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement
Others:

Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face
Signing of Non-Compete contract will be required upon successful selection

Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
At Franklin Templeton, everything we do is focused on one thing – delivering better client outcomes.  We do that by partnering closely with our clients, assessing their strategic needs, and identifying the solution or solutions that can meet the challenge.  Over 9,500 employees working in 34 countries around the world are dedicated to servicing investment solutions for our clients in more than 160 countries. For more than 70 years our success has been a direct result of the talent, skills and persistence of our people, and we are looking for qualified candidates to join our team.

We are looking for an Administrative Assistant to join our Singapore office. This role will cover front desk and administrative duties for the Templeton Global Investments (TGI) team.

What are the ongoing responsibilities of this position?
Administrative responsibilities

Assist and be a reliable support for the Administration Manager in all matters
Coordinate travel arrangements (booking of flights, hotels, transfers, visas etc) for the assigned staff/director(s) when required
Manage calendars for assigned staff/director(s) when required
Assist in expense preparation, submission and tracking for the assigned staff/director(s)
Check, record and obtain approvals for invoice payments
Coordinate and provide support with meetings, TGI events and conferences

Front desk responsibilities

Attend and receive guests at the reception on the assigned floor in a professional manner
Manage and coordinate meeting room calendars.
Assist with meeting room bookings and arrange refreshments where necessary
Handle incoming and outgoing mails, postage, parcels, couriers
Distribution of newspapers and magazines
Assist in pantry, office, stationery supplies orders and name cards requisitions when required
Floor facilities coordinator


What qualifications, skills and experience would help someone to be successful?

GCE ‘O’/‘A’ Level
1-3 years of experience in front desk, receptionist, administrative duties
Comfortable to sit at reception desk when required
Pleasant personality with good verbal and written communication skills
Team player who can also work independently
Effective interpersonal skills
Able to multitask
Meticulous, solution and detail-oriented
Good PC Skills with MS Office applications: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook


What makes Franklin Templeton unique?
In addition to the dynamic and professional environment at Franklin Templeton, we strive to ensure that our employees have access to a competitive and valuable set of Total Rewards—the mix of both monetary and non-monetary rewards provided to you in recognition for your time, talents, efforts, and results.
We believe that being a good corporate citizen is good business. To us, corporate citizenship means being accountable, serving our clients, being an employer of choice, managing our environmental impact, and supporting our communities. An emphasis on corporate citizenship is embedded in our culture and values, and is an important element of how we achieve success.
We are also committed to your learning and development with resources focused around Experience, Exposure, and Education, to help you achieve your professional development goals.
Franklin Templeton values diversity in its workforce and welcomes employees from different backgrounds, generations, capabilities, cultural identification, sexual orientations, and gender expression, in addition to other attributes that contribute to a truly diverse and inclusive community.
Franklin Templeton is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment. If you believe that you need a workplace arrangement to search for, or apply for, one of our positions please send an email to accommodations@franklintempleton.com. In your email, please include the arrangement you are requesting and the job title and job number you are applying for. We will review the request and make a best effort to enact the arrangement. It may take up to three business days to receive a response to your request. Please note that only requests for arrangements will receive a response.

We regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified.

title: Designer, Systems (Computer)
description:
StarFive is a leading provider of RISCV processors, platforms and solutions. StarFive products are widely used in smart home appliances, smart monitoring, industrial robots, traffic management, intelligent logistics, wearable devices, solid state storage, network communications and edge computing, etc.
We are intensively designing next generation high performance RISC-V CPU and RISC-V-based SoC chips. Talents who are passionate in research and development for future chips are welcomed to join us. Being part of this vibrant team, you can produce world class successful commercial chips supported by efficient software stacks.

Responsibilities：

Maintain the automation of development environment (CI testing) and integrate the performance modelling and simulation platform and framework for micro-architecture explorations
Investigate the current state of the art of CPUs and system on chip architecture including cache, on-chip interconnect, and memory hierarchy
Implement simulation models for performance modelling of System-on-Chip components like caches, interconnect, and memory controllers
Maintain, porting and cross-compile the benchmarks and master the sampling and trace-based simulation techniques
Join the activity of micro-architectural exploration and data analysis for different benchmarks a
Join the activity of architecture optimization for next generation of processor
Develop automation strategies to maintain our core performance simulation models with strict quality gating and high-quality data reporting

Qualification：

BS/MS with course work in Computer Architecture/Systems Engineering/Software Development
Familiarity with software development and integration; usage of tools like JIRA, GIT, GERRIT, JENKINS
Ability to setup benchmark suite (eg: Geekbench, SPEC), profile and gather performance results
Having basic knowledge of modern processor architecture and cross-compilation environment (e.g. embedded system development)
Able to program with assembly languages to enable benchmark porting and debugging
Competent in C/C++ and scripting languages (Perl/Python)
Skillful on working in Linux server environment
Fresh Graduates are welcome
Strong interpersonal skills, written and oral; good team player
Curiosity to learn and execute at fast pace; communicate effectively with mentors and other team members

description:

Working with Senior Engineer on Electrical engineering services design and project administration for building projects in Singapore & Overseas.

description:

Must have office computer skills like MS Excel, MS Words.
A committed, and confident team player with the ability to respond positively to client’s request for assistance.
Result oriented, self-driven and ability work independently in a fast pace environment with minimal supervision.
Job Description:
Job Description: 
Support the company business process by retrieving and updating corporate action information for online trading markets on daily basis.
Manage the processing of market live price approval on daily basis.
Provide the first line of support to clients’ and Trading Representatives’ email enquiries including questions about account status, password reset, reward enquiries.
Manage the processing of all online and manual reward subscription.
Proactively propose on process improvement by automating various manual processing tasks.
Website maintenance and announcements in the POEMS website, ensure the POEMS website is updated promptly and correctly.
Attending some ah-hoc duties like dispatching of pin mailers to external clients; monthly data reporting to various exchanges for market data feed.

Job Requirements: 
Minimum Diploma and above in any discipline.
No experience required for entry level.
Bilingual and proficient in both languages (English and Chinese).
Must have office computer skills like MS Excel, MS Words.
A committed, and confident team player with the ability to respond positively to client’s request for assistance.
Result oriented, self-driven and ability work independently in a fast pace environment with minimal supervision.

title: Scientist (Electronic Materials), IMRE
description:
Job Description
The job is to establish and enhance high-quality piezoelectric material growth capability, and obtain piezoelectric materials with competitive electromechanical performance properties, particularly including piezoelectric single-crystals, as demanded for producing high performance ultrasonic transducers.
Requirements:

PhD in physics, material science, engineering
Passion in use-inspired basic science or development of functional materials with competitive performance properties for device applications
Hands-on experience, expertise, and skills in growing high performance piezoelectric single-crystals, particularly including Bridgman and/or solid-state crystal growth method
R&D experience on any of the following topics is preferred but not necessary: ferroelectric thin films, ferroelectric physics, piezoelectric characterizations, ultrasonic transducers, and ultrasonic imaging
Good track record in publication, patent, or commercialization in the relevant areas as stated above


The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Civil & Structural Engineer
description:
Job Highlight

Office is within walking distance to Tai Seng MRT
5 days work week
Career Growth

Requirements

Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's Degree in Civil & Structural Engineering recognized by PE Board, Singapore
A minimum of 3 years of working experience in an engineering consulting company. Fresh graduates are also welcome to apply and will be considered based on qualifications and potential.
Competent user of relevant engineering software
Effective communication and teamwork abilities

Responsibilities

Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to design and develop innovative civil and structural solutions.
Preparing civil and structural design calculations/engineering reports
Obtaining planning and/or building regulations approval
Liaising with relevant government authorities, stakeholders and project team
Good knowledge of 3D/FEM design software such as Etabs is an advantage
To carry out engineering design according to Eurocodes or relevant informational design codes
Carrying out building inspections & reports on findings
To attend project meetings with Clients and Consultants from other disciplines
To attend site progress meetings and reply to technical queries

title: Web Developer & Full-Stack Coding Intern
description:
Quick Apply: You may send your Resume/CV to recruitment@singaporetuitionteachers.com or apply via MyCareersFuture.
Office Location: 28 Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Bright Hill/Marymount/Bishan MRT)
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:

MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture

Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:

Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.

Learning Outcomes & Objectives:

Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary

Requirements:

Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently

Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:

5 Days Work Week, Weekdays 9.00am - 6.30pm
Midview City (Sin Ming Lane)
Closest MRTs: Bright-Hill MRT (Door-Step), Bishan / Marymount MRT (nearby)
$1,000 - $1,200/Month
Interns will also be given several days of paid leave (depending on internship period)

Why Choose Us:

Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics!
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
Conveniently located with New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep

Application:

Submit an e-mail application with Resume/CV to mindflex.recruitment@gmail.com with Email Title "Web Developer Intern Application"
Please ensure to include the following in Email and attached documents:

1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Suitable Profile Picture of Yourself
4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement
Others:

Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face
Signing of Non-Compete contract will be required upon successful selection

Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.

title: IT Sales Executive
description:
We are seeking a IT Sales Executive to take over a mix of existing accounts and new sales territory. To excel in this role, you should be a hunter role, an active listener, have a compelling sales personality, and have a hunger to chase and close new business from cold calls and warm inbound leads.

Apptools is the Official Singapore distributor for AVAST and AVG business endpoints.

IT Sales Executive Responsibilities:

Planning and overseeing new marketing initiatives.
Contacting potential clients to establish rapport and arrange meetings.
Researching organisations and individuals to find new opportunities.
Cold calling to find new leads
Increasing the value of current customers while attracting new ones.
Finding and developing new markets and improving sales.
Attending conferences, meetings, and industry events.
Developing quotes and proposals for clients.
Developing goals for the development team and business growth and ensuring they are met.

Direct B2B Sales
Small and Medium Business (SMB/SME) market 
Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing or a related field.
Fresh Graduates are welcome and eager to learn

Proven sales track record
Self-motivated
Strong communication skills and IT fluency.
Ability to manage complex projects and multi-task.
Excellent organizational skills.
Ability to flourish with minimal guidance, be proactive, and handle uncertainty.

title: Contract QC Chemist (Pharma MNC, Renewable, Up to $5500) #HHO
description:
Job Responsibilities

Perform analytical testing accurately and efficiently and in accordance to Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
Able to assess the impact to products based on monograph changes/updates/introduction.
Able to support regulatory submissions and queries.
Perform equipment verification and calibration in accordance to procedures.
Document all results in accordance to Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) requirements.
Ensure all quality records are attached and/or file as predetermined.
Write and review Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and On the Job Training (OJTs) for the laboratory.
Conduct Laboratory investigations.
Perform maintenance and troubleshooting of laboratory equipment where required.
Perform equipment qualification and analytical method validation where required.
Perform laboratory equipment verification and calibration in accordance to procedures where required.
Ensure all documentations and quality records are conducted in accordance to Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) requirements and that they are filed in accordance to existing policies.
Train fellow colleagues on written procedures and SOPs pertaining to equipment operation, analytical and microbiological test methods and general laboratory operation.
Perform review and approval of test results in the Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS).
Perform proactive trending of analytical results

Requirements

Min Degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Food Science or any related course of studies
A minimum of 1 year QC experience in the pharmaceutical industry.
Candidates without experience are welcome to apply as training will be provided
Experience in using HPLC, GC is a must
1 Year Contract, highly renewable
Transport Pick up with entitlement to transport allowance


All qualified applicants, please send in your resume to:
lynnho@recruitexpress.com.sg

title: Fund Operations Executive
description:
Company Description
Protege Fund Services is an independent Singapore based Fund Administrator. We serve a growing list of sophisticated client base ranging from individual private clients to large financial corporations.

We believe in building a long-term working relationship with our clients to create successful partnerships through customized and innovative solutions. Safeguarding our clients' privacy and confidentiality interests through robust operational processes and original solutions is our top priority.

Role Description
This is a full-time Fund Operations role located in Singapore. Some remote work is acceptable. As a Fund Operations executive, you will support day-to-day fund lifecycle activities from fund inception to trade data entry and reconciliation. You will also be expected to support automation initiatives and special projects.

Roles & Responsibilities

Reports to the Fund Operations Partner
Responsibility includes supporting investor relations, fund accounting and portfolio reporting activities
Assist with fund accounting entries of trades and cash transactions into fund accounting systems
Perform portfolio reconciliation with external parties
Ensure a smooth deliver of NAV packs and fund reports to fund managers and investors
Exposure to multiple asset classes and funds including both liquid and non-liquid strategies
Exposure to fund setup process and various fund structures
Support in designing and implementing fund administration process automation initiatives to improve operational efficiencies and resiliency


Requirements

Good team-player and possesses excellent working attitude
Basic knowledge of financial markets and financial products
Basic knowledge of accounting and understanding of financial statements
Knowledge in SQL or Excel VBA will be a plus
Diploma or Degree in business/ finance/ accounting
Candidates looking for career change are welcomed to apply
Fresh graduates from Singapore Polytechnics and/or Universities are also welcomed to apply


Attractive remuneration + casual dress code + flexible work arrangement

title: QC Lab Technician
description:
THE ROLE
This individual will assist the QC Manager in managing Quality Checks for all raw materials and finished goods as well as maintaining all Quality documentation.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

The incumbent works closely with the QC Manager on all aspects of Quality Control, in particular, on product reliability and compliance with all established product standards. Ensures that all aspects of quality within the organization are upheld.
This position reports directly to the QC Manager.
The incumbent maintains overall purviews for all aspects of quality within the organization and hence, is entrusted with developing checks to ensure that standards are maintained and/or exceeded.
Inspects all incoming raw material for compliance according to current standards.
Conducts periodic checks and analyses on all WIPs.
Retains finished product samples from production to conduct checks and analysis.
Prepare test solutions, compounds, or reagents for laboratory use.
Assist QA with failure analyses, and corrective and preventive action response to customer’s complaint.
Work with various departments on the maintenance of company quality manuals pertaining to operating procedures.
Assist in GMP audits, validation, qualification, and change control.
Assist in maintaining Product Quality and Technical File.

REQUIREMENTS

Diploma in Chemical Process Technology, Pharm, Biotechnology / Degree in Chemistry, Quality Assurance
Able to do 12-hour rotating shifts (4-day work week and night shift)

People are at the heart of great things at Recruit Express

The Role of a Recruiter

A Recruiter’s job is a hybrid role – it is not just about recruitment. It also encompasses business development, account management, marketing, customer service all rolled into one. It is about understanding people’s needs and motivations, and managing clients’ and candidates’ expectations. It

title: [DTL] Assistant Engineer, Signalling
description:
Responsibilities:

Supervise the maintenance team and support the Executives in the maintenance, inventory and documentation of the signalling and platform screen door system in Downtown Line to ensure a safe and reliable system
Lead and supervise the team in the maintenance activities in accordance with the maintenance procedures and safety plans
Plan, organize and ensure scheduled maintenance activities are performed in accordance with the planned maintenance schedule
Ensure good coordination, fast response on failures and rectified within reasonable time
Ensure timely compilation and submission of fault and maintenance reports for review
Participate in the investigations and fault analysis of persistence faults and remedial actions
Perform general documentation, proper filings and assist in updating of document and drawings
Participate in the administration of the maintenance logistics required to ensure proper functioning of all maintenance activities
Required to drive company vehicles where necessary during work duties
Ensure good housekeeping practices and security of signalling maintenance office, workshops and equipment room in station and depot
Perform safety inspection and auditing of the signalling and platform screen door system
Expected to possess basic inventory management skills in handling of tools, spare inventory accountability in an orderly and safely approach
Conduct in house trainings for new staff

Possess a polytechnic Diploma in Mechatronics / Electrical / Electronics / Computer Engineering or equivalent
Preferably minimum 2 to 3 years of work experience maintenance environment
Good supervisory skill, strong in planning and organizing
Good communication, analytical and interpersonal skills
Preferably possess a Class 3 driving license (manual transmission)
Able to supervise and work as a team at all levels
A team player, result oriented and self-motivated
Able to perform 3 rotating shifts
Must be able to differentiate colors for work purposes

title: (W) Entry-Level : Trainee Vertical Transportation Technician / Assistant Lift & Escalator (L&E) Specialist [ NITEC in Built Environment - Vertical Transportation / ITE ]
description:
The hiring company is seeking a motivated Entry-Level Vertical Transportation Technicians to join the team and embark on an exciting career in the maintenance, repair, and servicing of elevators, escalators, and other vertical transportation systems.
As a recent graduates with relevant certifications from the Institute of Technical Education (ITE), you will receive comprehensive training and mentorship to develop your skills in this specialized field. Your role will involve supporting experienced technicians, conducting routine maintenance tasks, and ensuring the smooth operation and safety of these systems. The hiring company value effective communication, a passion for learning, and a commitment to exceptional customer service in their entry-level technicians.
Job Details:

Working Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. (5 days a week)
Starting Monthly Base Salary: SGD 2,000 + Monthly Fixed Allowance
Potential Monthly Gross Salary: From SGD 2,300 ++
Additional Benefits: AWS (13th Month Bonus)

Key Responsibilities:

Assist experienced technicians in conducting routine maintenance tasks, including inspection, lubrication, and adjustment of mechanical components.
Learn to diagnose and assist in the repair of malfunctions or defects under the guidance of senior technicians.
Participate in testing and inspecting safety devices to ensure compliance with regulations.
Collaborate with the team to recommend and replace worn or damaged parts, contributing to the reliability and longevity of the systems.
Provide support in on-site repairs and promptly respond to emergency breakdowns to minimize disruptions for clients.
Maintain accurate records of maintenance and repair work for documentation and continuous improvement.

Entry Requirements:

Hold (1) of the following certificate from the Institute of Technical Education (ITE):


Nitec in Built Environment (Vertical Transportation)
Nitec in Technology - Built Environment (Vertical Transportation)
Nitec in Built Environment (Vertical Transportation) (Traineeship)
Nitec in Technology - Facility Technology (Vertical Transportation)


No prior experience is required as training and mentorship will be provided.
Demonstrated ability to travel across Singapore for job assignments, with or without own motorbike.
Comfortable working at heights and in confined spaces.

If you hold a relevant certificate from the Institute of Technical Education (ITE) in Vertical Transportation and comfortable to travel across Singapore for job assignments, we invite you to apply for the role of Entry-Level Vertical Transportation Technician. Join the team of dedicated professionals and gain hands-on experience, professional growth, and a pathway to becoming a seasoned vertical transportation specialist. title: IT Executive
description:

Provide training to users in the usage of systems and access to networks.
Maintain and review IT documentation, covering infrastructure, inventory, service subscriptions and contracts.
Provide input for annual IT requirements planning and budgeting.
Analyse, and evaluate system and users’ requirements and make recommendations for IT upgrades.
Proactively identify acquisition opportunities of new innovation initiatives in line with the strategic objectives of the school.

Undertake any other related assignment that may be given by the manager and/or his/her designate.

Good understanding of Google Workspace ecosystem and Microsoft Office.
Familiarity with various products which include Chromebooks, Macbooks, iMacs and Apple TV, Chromecast etc.
Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot basic technical issues.

title: Trainee Technician
description:
ALG is currently recruiting for Trainee Technicians with our Engine MRO client.

This traineeship is an opportunity for aspiring individuals who are keen to join aviation industry but do not meet the pre-requisites as a trained aircraft engine technician. Upon successful completion of the programme, a career as a qualified aircraft engine technician awaits you.

Job Responsibilities:

The programme involves a fully-sponsored training programme with an allowance over the one-year training period.
Upon completion of the training, the qualified aircraft engine technician will serve a two-year or four-year bond.
Career progression opportunity is open to promising technicians.
The programme encompasses initial company familiarisation, classroom training and on-the-job training.
The initial familiarisation provides an insight to the working environment prior to attending classroom training.
The three-month classroom training, consisting of theory and practical sessions, will be conducted and assessed by an external training academy.
The nine-month on-the-job training provides the opportunity to learn and work on the renowned Engines.

Job Requirements:

NITEC / Higher NITEC / Diploma in Engineering (eg. Aeronautical/Avionics/Mechanical/Mechatronics/Manufacturing/ Electrical/Precision)
Completed full-time National Service (for locals)
Able to perform rotating shift work
Willing to work in Changi

If you are interested in this role, please APPLY NOW! Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Tax, Associate / Senior
description:
We have opportunities for interested candidates in our tax department - GST and Corporate Tax. Your main responsibility will be to provide timely and accurate services for our clients, and to analyse transaction structures and assist by providing preliminary findings in respect of tax due diligence reviews, restructuring advice and ad-hoc tax advisory projects, etc.

Responsibilities:
GST

Assist with GST compliance work, which involves preparation and/or review of clients’ GST returns prior to submission
Assist with the application of GST registration, exemption, and schemes
Assist clients with IRAS GST audits and queries
Opportunities to liaise with clients as part of servicing the assigned portfolios and develop client relationships and seek out additional business opportunities
Opportunities to conduct GST healthchecks such as Assisted Self-Help Kit (ASK) reviews, and Assisted Compliance Assurance Programme (ACAP) reviews
Opportunities to have advisory exposure in the course of handling GST compliance work, advising clients on  GST implications and applicable treatment of their business transactions
Opportunities to meet and prospect new clients as part of growing the GST business

Corporate Tax

Extract and analyse financial/tax data and understand the business operation to identify potential tax risks of a target.
Coordinate and attend meetings with clients, target’s representatives and inter-office advisors.
Assist in preparing reports, in particular for tax due diligence or reviewing sales and purchase agreements to meet the tight turnaround time.
Assist in tax research/preparatory work and prepare the advisory work within the tight turnaround time.
Collate and gather information from inter-office people for fee proposals, deliverables, etc.
Prepare marketing collaterals or presentations.
Assist in pitching for new clients or projects including preparing meaningful proposals and attending meetings.
It could range from deferred tax analysis to preparing tax computations for corporate and individual
Administrative work such as folder management, risk management, etc

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in accounting or relevant disciplines, such as ACCA or Diploma in Accountancy or Business management.
1 - 3 years and 2 - 5 years of relevant experience will be considered for Associate and Senior roles respectively, but candidates with no experience are also welcome to apply!
A team player with strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Possesses good writing skills.
Demonstrates critical thinking skills and good attention to details.
Exposures to ASK reviews, and ACAP reviews would be an advantage.

title: 23701644 Officer, Fund Accounting - Hybrid
description:
Job Description
The Fund Accounting Analyst is an entry level position responsible for assisting in a variety of fund valuation activities in coordination with the Operations - Transaction Services team. The overall objective of this role is to assist in the calculation of daily and periodic Net Asset Valuations (NAVs) for funds and the distribution of associated unit prices.

Responsibilities:

Monitor the work activities to ensure timeliness/accuracy of the funds activities in a department, including calculation of NAV and distribution factors
Assist in reviewing stock and cash reconciliations as a Checker to ensure the exceptions noted have no NAV impact and items cleared are treated correctly
Ensure corporate actions are correctly reflected on the NAV
Assist in handling complex issues
Facilitate prompt investigation and resolution of any client queries in a timely and professional manner
Ensure client Service Level Agreement (SLA) and deadlines are met
Assist in the collection and analysis of relevant management information from an operational and client perspective
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications:

0-2 years of relevant experience preferred
Experience in accounting, finance, or business-related area
Experience within Financial Services or Operations
Proven experience in funds administration
Knowledge of funds services and processes

Education:

Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent experience

title: Digital Marketing Executive
description:
We are seeking for a passionate marketing specialist to drive effective marketing strategies promoting PhillipCapital brand name, MyWealth app and SMART Series products to the retail clients via various online and offline marketing channels.
Responsibilities:

Develop, design and execute full spectrum of marketing plan and strategy to promote PhillipCapital brand name, MyWealth app and SMART Series products.
Conceptualise key marketing messages, content and creative works covering all print and digital medias.
Drive product website experience, with focus on website analytics to look into online account acquisition through the marketing funnel and ensure customer experience optimization.
Conduct market intelligence on competitors’ platform/ feature releases, promotion and marketing activities.
Measure and evaluate the performance of various marketing campaigns/ activities (online and offline) against set goals (ROI and OKR).
Provide client servicing support to clients whenever necessary;
Provide support to sales channel whenever necessary.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Finance, Mass Communication or related field.
1 year relevant marketing/business development experience is preferred.
Proven experience in digital marketing, programmatic, pay-per-click campaigns, managing Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Search Engine Marketing (SEM), marketing databases, email, social media and/or display advertising avenues.
Solid knowledge of marketing analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Appsflyer, etc.)
Good eye for design. Experience in UI/UX expertise is a plus
Result oriented, self-driven and ability work independently in a fast pace environment with minimal supervision.
Familiarity with financial products will be an added advantage
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Candidates without prior working experience are welcome to apply.
Financial Advisory experience and accreditation in CMFAS M5, M6, M8, M9 & HI is an advantage.

title: Senior Associate, Compliance and Advisory
description:
Job Highlights:

You will be part of a growing and dynamic team managing a portfolio of client companies listed on the Catalist Board of the Singapore Exchange.
Your primary responsibility will be to advise on regulatory compliance and good corporate governance for listed companies.
You will have the opportunity to work closely with Singapore’s leading businesses and be part of a firm supporting the growth and development of small-medium enterprises in the region.
Qualities to succeed in this role would include, being a team player and having an analytical and meticulous mindset as well as ability to work under tight timelines.


External Auditors who are looking for corporate and want to gain experience in the commercial sector, the opportunity is here for you:
Our client is an established corporate finance house with a long-standing reputation. An expert in the small-medium enterprise space across various disciplines – IPOs, corporate advisory for listed companies, Catalist sponsorship, underwriting and share placement, fund raising, mergers and acquisition, equity research and fund management. They are currently one of the market leaders in terms of Catalist Sponsorship clients in Singapore with clients in various industries ranging from consumer services, technology, construction and F&B.

About the role
The individual will be part of a growing and dynamic team managing a portfolio of client companies listed on the Catalist Board of the Singapore Exchange.
The primary responsibility of the individual will be to advise on regulatory compliance and good corporate governance for listed companies.
Individuals will have the opportunity to work with Singapore’s leading businesses and be part of a firm supporting the growth and development of small-medium enterprises in the region.
Qualities to succeed in this role would include, being a team player and having an analytical and meticulous mindset as well as ability to work under tight timelines.


Job Responsibilities:

Provide support in managing a portfolio of client companies listed on the Catalist Board of the Singapore Exchange
Provide necessary advice for listed companies’ directors and management on continuing listing obligations and corporate governance matters
Maintain an excellent relationship with the regulators through close and regular dialogues to drive resolution of issues
Conduct compliance review of corporate actions carried out by clients, including shareholder circulars, public announcements and press releases
Drive regulatory applications/notifications to clients and stakeholders and addressing regulators’ queries and requests in a satisfactorily and timely manner
Prepare/maintain documentation, compliance papers for internal committee approvals and application/consultation letters to the Singapore Exchange
Assist in providing training on relevant listing rules and regulatory matters to stakeholders
Monitor daily share price and media reports of clients
Carry out ad-hoc tasks/projects as requested by the immediate team leader

Job Requirements:

Degree in Accountancy/Business/Finance
0 to 3 years of external audit working experience from Big-4 Companies are preferred
Familiar with financial statement
Have good understanding in financial statements and analysis
Self-motivated, responsible, meticulous, strong analytical ability and project management skills, able to work independently and a good team player
Able to communicate effectively with clients, regulators and other professionals such as lawyers, auditors, financial advisors and valuers
Qualities to succeed in this role would include, being a team player and having an analytical and meticulous mindset as well as ability to work under tight timelines.
Candidate with no experience are welcome to apply.


If you are shortlisted for the first round of screening, our Recruiter will contact you directly.

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Responsibilities:

Deliver stable, efficient, and reliable Cloud Infrastructure and operations.
Support implementation and testing of installation of Cloud Infrastructure.
Write and maintain custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower the human intervention time on any tasks. (Infrastructure as code, AWS CloudFormation).
Perform daily performance monitoring, analysis, and maintenance to ensure system Cloud Infrastructure performed.
Support Cloud Infrastructure Operations, resolve Cloud Infrastructure incidents.
Diagnose problem source through discussions with users.
Escalate problems or issues to higher management.
Support implementation of preventive measures, planned maintenance events, system backup processes and disaster recovery drills.
Support reports on performance and availability of Cloud Infrastructure systems by reviewing of service uptime, utilization, and throughput.


Requirements:

Bachelor`s degree in technical, Polytechnic diploma in technical or equivalent experience.
It is important that they have relevant cloud certifications such as AWS Cloud Practitioner or Sys Ops .
Familiarity with containerization technologies such as Docker , Kubernetes Docker and EKS. and Public cloud delivery know-how with AWS and/or Azure
Hands-on AWS experience with at least 1 implementation
Familiar with one of the enterprise operating systems (Microsoft Windows Server (20012 & up) and/or RHEL 7, 8)
Competent and having a sound knowledge (Configure and troubleshoot) of various network protocols and topologies, including a broad knowledge of WLAN, switches, routers, servers, IPS/IDS and firewalls

title: IT Executive
description:
The Write Connection is a premier education company in Singapore. We are looking for an IT Executive to support the daily operations of our centres by joining our Internal Operations Team.
Job Responsibilities

Provide daily IT support for IT-related issues and requests. This includes hardware maintenance, software application, hardware upgrades, and system installation.
Manage/participate in new setup or upgrade of systems and monitor system utilisation.
Perform troubleshooting or provide alternatives to resolve cases that are raised across various centres.
Assist with IT projects from conceptualisation, planning, execution to completion.
Ensure the deadlines of IT deliverables are met with desired quality, and communicated to various departments.
Maintain records of IT hardware, software, inventory, service and IT related contracts and documentation.
Ensure compliance with IT security policies and regulations.
Perform problem management and troubleshooting of network operating issues, desktop applications, hardware cause identification and resolution.
Perform any other special projects as assigned.
Assist with other scopes under the internal operations department.

Job Requirements

Possess at least a Diploma in IT, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Able to work efficiently to meet tight deadlines, organise time well, and work with minimum supervision.
Knowledge of Google Sheets, Google Forms, Google App Script, HTML/CSS, Apple systems and devices, and ECOS would be favourable.
Technically savvy and/or fast learner of technology.
Comfortable using the Mac platform.
Possess excellent communication skills to work with stakeholders and ensure that works meet requirements, and expected timelines.
Proficiency in spoken and written Mandarin is a plus as the work would involve collaboration with technical teams based in China

Work Hours and Location:

5 days work week: includes 4 weekdays and 1 weekend (which can be a Sat or Sun depending on roster)
Shifts: Weekdays: 12.30pm - 9.30pm , Weekends: 8.30am - 6.30pm
Work Location: TWC HQ, Guthrie House, Bukit Timah. (Candidate may be required to travel to various TWC centres)

Note to Applicant:

Only Singaporeans and PR need apply.
Send your CV to Recruitment@TheWriteConnection.com.sg

title: Web Developer & Full-Stack Coding Intern
description:
Quick Apply: You may send your Resume/CV to recruitment@singaporetuitionteachers.com or apply via MyCareersFuture.
Office Location: 28 Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Bright Hill/Marymount/Bishan MRT)
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:

MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture

Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:

Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.

Learning Outcomes & Objectives:

Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary

Requirements:

Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently

Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:

title: Sales consultant (Professional Financial Planner)
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Professional Financial Planner to join our team. As a Professional Financial Planner, you will play a crucial role in assisting our clients in achieving their financial goals and securing their financial future. Your expertise and guidance will be essential in providing comprehensive financial planning services tailored to each client's unique needs and objectives.

1-1 Mentorship will be provided.

Responsibilities:

Client Consultation: Conduct in-depth consultations with clients to understand their financial objectives, risk tolerance, and current financial situation.
Financial Analysis: Analyze clients' financial status by evaluating their income, expenses, investments, insurance coverage, and tax strategies.
Goal Setting: Collaborate with clients to define short-term and long-term financial goals, such as retirement planning, education funding, estate planning, and wealth accumulation.
Customized Planning: Develop personalized financial plans that encompass investment strategies, risk management, retirement planning, tax optimization, and estate planning.
Investment Strategies: Recommend appropriate investment portfolios based on clients' risk profiles, financial goals, and market trends, while keeping their preferences and time horizon in mind.
Regular Monitoring: Continuously review and monitor clients' financial plans and investment portfolios to ensure alignment with their objectives and adjust strategies as needed.
Financial Education: Educate clients about financial concepts, investment options, and potential risks, empowering them to make informed decisions.
Compliance and Regulations: Stay updated on financial regulations, industry trends, and best practices to ensure adherence to legal and ethical standards.
Client Relationships: Foster strong, long-term relationships with clients by providing exceptional service, addressing inquiries, and adapting strategies to changing circumstances.
Networking: Collaborate with other professionals, such as attorneys and accountants, to provide comprehensive financial solutions and enhance client outcomes.

Qualifications:

Fresh graduates may apply
Diploma from a local polytechnic (TP, SP, NYP, RP, NP)
Bachelor's degree 
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
Ability to build trust and rapport with clients
Proficiency in financial planning software and tools
Knowledge of relevant financial regulations and compliance
