title: Social Care Associate *
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

NTUC Health Co-operative Limited (NTUC Health) is an NTUC social enterprise that provides a comprehensive and integrated suite of quality and affordable health and eldercare services to meet the growing needs of families and their dependents. Building on more than four decades of experience and expertise, NTUC Health is among the largest senior day care, nursing home and home personal care providers in Singapore. It also offers other services for seniors such as an active ageing hub, senior activity centres, community support for vulnerable seniors, and a sheltered / senior group home. In addition, it runs a chain of dental clinics, and a family medicine clinic

RESPONSIBILITIES

NTUC Health is one of the largest community health and eldercare providers in Singapore. We want to make a difference in our community by continuously exploring and expanding our services. At our nursing homes, we develop services and deliver care with our residents at heart, especially those with dementia and other conditions requiring round-the-clock care.
In this role as a Social Care Associate, you shall work with other care staff to conduct engagement activities to improve well-being, cognitive function and social participation of the seniors in our nursing home. You are responsible for ensuring that nursing home residents are meaningfully engaged through activities that take into account their interests, habits and therapeutic goals. If you are passionate about engaging seniors and enjoy a collaborative work environment, you will be able to create a fulfilling and rewarding career for yourself.
Engage residents and family members frequently to gain insights and create engagement activities to support the residents’ therapeutic and social well-being objectives.
Conduct daily engagement activities with the residents on an individual or group basis.
Support therapeutic and social well being objectives of care plans through active engagement of the residents.  
Develop activities for residents according to their preferred choice of activities (e.g. cooking, hobbies and games).
Perform delegated administrative work in the relevant areas of job scope such as systematic recording of engagement activities to facilitate reviews and analysis
Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS
Preferably “N” level qualification or at least 2 years of experience in customer service, programme planning or facilitating activities
Passionate to serve the elderly
Pleasant disposition, approachable and has a service oriented personality 
Self-motivated individual who is willing to learn and has a growth mindset
Excellent listening and communication skills 
Proficient in Google Suite Workspace Applications (Gmail, Google sheet, Google doc)

OTHER INFORMATION
Additional Advantageous Skills:
Prior exposure in healthcare or social work settings or as an individual caregiver to your own loved ones would be advantageous
Ability to speak other languages including Mandarin and dialects, Tamil, Malay will be advantageous.
The employee may be required to work on some weekends and weekday evenings to conduct engagement activities and cater to residents’ needs.
*There are multiple locations for this position.

    Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - NTUC Health

title: Mailroom Specialist (Basic+Allowances+AWS)
description:
What Does Company Offer:
· Earn up to $1,800/month
· Full Salary during Training
· On-the-Job Training provided
· Additional Work Allowances
. Additional Offsite Allowances
· Paid Overtime (OT)
· Other Work Benefits
· AWS

Must be willing to work at these locations:
- CBD area
- Newton
- Tampines

Role
The Mailroom Specialist is a member of a team responsible for service delivery through efficient mailroom operations at an Iron Mountain customer site. It is paramount for the Mailroom Specialist to be able to provide a balance between efficiency and cost consciousness while delighting the customer by exceeding expectations.

Responsibilities

Deliver a great service and build strong trusted relationships with client
Deliver a range of mail services and support to the client with minimal or no supervision
Sort, distribute and collect mails, internal and external
Process both domestic and international couriers
Fill relevant details in distribution and shipping forms, providing accurate information to ensure that mails are delivered to the right locations and people.
Deliver internal and external tracked items
Adhere to mail delivery run schedules
Processing of unknown / ambiguous mail
Support ad-hoc document fulfilment project
Assist front counter desk for walk in clients
Handle mail related phone enquiries
Ad-hoc internal and external deliveries and pick-ups as required
Liaise with external mail vendors for collection / delivery arrangements

Identify and implement opportunities for process improvement
All other duties as assigned by management

Minimum of 2-year experience in mailroom, courier service, logistics industry
(Applicants without experience will be considered for entry-level position)
Ability to carry at least 10kg of weight
Willing to be deployed across different sites on short notice
Excellent customer service and communication skills
Proven record working in a fast-paced and time sensitive environment with little to no errors
Able to manage multiple concurrent deadlines and responsibilities at once
Absolute team player, and look to enjoy working with a close-knit team
Attention to detail, responsible and organized
Basic computer literacy skills in MS Excel and Word
Willing to Overtime (OT) as per required
Acceptable to do cross-functional learning/job rotation as per Management’s request
Willing to work at CBD area, Newton and Tampines

title: Order Fulfilment Assistant
description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Order Fulfillment Assistant to join our team. The Order Fulfillment Assistant will be responsible for processing customer orders, ensuring accurate and timely order fulfillment, and providing excellent customer service. This role plays a critical part in delivering a positive customer experience and maintaining efficient order management.

Responsibilities:

Receive and review customer orders for accuracy and completeness.
Confirm product availability and coordinate with the warehouse team for order fulfillment.
Prepare and pack orders for shipment while ensuring proper packaging and labeling.
Generate shipping labels, invoices, and other necessary documentation.
Coordinate with carriers and logistics providers to arrange for timely deliveries.
Track order shipments and update customers on order status.
Handle customer inquiries and provide exceptional customer service regarding order-related matters.
Assist with returns and exchanges, processing them efficiently.
Maintain accurate records of order data and update the order management system.
Collaborate with other departments to resolve order-related issues or discrepancies.
Contribute to improving order fulfillment processes and maintaining a clean and organized work area.

Requirements:

High school diploma or equivalent; a diploma in a related field is a plus.
Proven experience in order fulfillment, logistics, or a similar role is preferred.
Strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.
Basic computer skills, including experience with order management software.
Effective communication skills and a customer-centric approach.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines.
Knowledge of shipping and logistics processes.
Physical fitness to handle and move packages.
Team player with a positive attitude and a willingness to learn.
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and multitask effectively.

This is a full-time position. Working hours are Monday through Friday, 9am to 5:30pm.

title: Associate, Care Concierge (Home Care) (2 -year Contract)
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

NTUC Health is one of the largest community health and eldercare providers in Singapore. With a fast-growing presence, the organisation is recruiting passionate individuals who wish to serve the interest of a senior person. 
In this role, you will support the customer service leads in managing customer enquiries on NTUC Health’s services satisfactorily and following up on service applications. You will need to effectively work across different teams to ensure that customers queries and applications are properly attended to.
 The customer service team will be accountable for the overall customer satisfaction metrics and organisation goals in alignment with the business strategy.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Receive regular training on NTUC Health’s services in order to provide suitable service recommendations to customers
Handle phone and email enquiries of current and prospective customers of NTUC Health, and deliver consistent good customer service at all times 
Understand and evaluate needs of customers, promote the value of NTUC Health services, and facilitate enrolment to these services 
Work closely with other services and divisions in NTUC Health to jointly manage customer enquiries and applications, and any service feedback
Track and monitor customers’ enquiries and feedback from all channels such as the hotline, e-mails, Whatsapp, etc. and that enquiries are resolved in a timely manner
Support the training of a new generative AI tool to achieve a high accuracy rate, including auditing the generated answers and editing replies
Organise and participate in roadshows to promote NTUC Health services 
Meet Key Performance Indicators
Perform any other duties that may be assigned from time to time by the Reporting Officer.

QUALIFICATIONS
Preferably general degree or minimum ‘A’ Levels with some customer service experiences
Someone with strong written and verbal communication skills
Someone who is resourceful 
Someone who is patient and enjoys working with a senior person
Someone who is meticulous and dependable in terms of meeting deadlines and following up on outstanding items
Prior experience in the healthcare or community care sector is preferred
Proficiency in a 2nd language would be advantageous
Have keen interest in digital systems and be tech savvy

OTHER INFORMATION
Familiar with Google workspace collaborative tools

description:

Office Location: 28 Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Bright Hill/Marymount/Bishan MRT)
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:

MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture

Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:

Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.

Learning Outcomes & Objectives:

Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary

Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems

Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us

title: Senior / Physiotherapist (Locum)
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Since October 2011, Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities (THKMC) was incorporated as a charity with an IPC status to provide multiple social and welfare services to the community at large.
THKMC provides assistance to the various groups in our community through more than 60 programmes and services for the elderly and the sick, families, persons with disabilities, and children.  We help anyone in need with full respect to their race, colour, creed, language, culture and religion. We have more than 90 programmes and services, reaching out to more than 55,000 people in the community.
Together, as ONETHK – Empowering the Community.

RESPONSIBILITIES

THK Therapy Service Division (TS) provides occupational therapy, physiotherapy and speech language therapy services to THKMC programmes and other community organisations. TS adopts a holistic client and family-centred care approach by working with transdisciplinary or multidisciplinary professional teams, families, and other community partners. Through individual and group therapy sessions, TS addresses the various needs of clients ranging from paediatric to geriatric.
Our Physiotherapist (PT) is directly involved in the provision of therapy services related to mobility, function and independence for the pediatric and/or adult population.
S/he is responsible for the assessment, intervention provision, and management of caseload given.
The PT works collaboratively in a team that may consist of administrative executives, teachers, medical doctors, nurses, other Allied Health Professionals (AHPs).
S/he plays an important role in providing consultation and training to different AHPs, medical staff, teachers, and caregivers.
S/he performs administrative tasks and takes part in projects specific to the work setting.
S/he should be a responsible clinician who takes initiative to learn and to improve his/her work.
We are currently looking for Physiotherapist in adult settings to serve our clients at places such as:
Day Rehabilitation Centre
Disability Services
Home Therapy
 
QUALIFICATIONS
Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Physiotherapy recognized by Allied Health Professions Council (AHPC) Singapore, or have passed the Qualifying Examinations recognized by AHPC.
 
OTHER INFORMATION
Possess good communication skills, interpersonal skills, positive attitude, team player, hard-working and proactive.
Strong desire to maintain high professional standards for quality service and professionalism.
Islandwide location
 

    Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities

title: Power Electronics / Electrical Engineer / Research Engineer
description:
Aliena is a leading Singapore-based space-tech company, aiming at providing high-resolution data to terrestrial businesses by enabling a fleet of imaging satellites to fly closer to the Earth using our proprietary electric propulsion engines. In January 2022 Aliena broke the record for the smallest satellite ever to launch with a Hall plasma thruster on board.

We impact lives on Earth by bringing space closer to home. We develop low power engines that enable satellites to fly closer to Earth and provide impactful high quality data to various market segments such as banking & finance, maritime, aviation, agriculture, energy, security, and defence at an affordable rate.

Our engines are mission agnostic, and while our vision is centred around the very low earth orbit, all types of missions are welcome, in any branch of pace exploration or space economy.

By joining our dynamic and visionary team, you will take part in defining the future of Earth observation and state-of-the-art low power plasma propulsion systems.

Your responsibilities

Perform the electrical design, simulation and analysis of power      electronics circuits and systems to meet technical product requirements.      The main focus will be on DC-DC power converters.
Conduct the electrical debug, test, characterization, and      validation of power electronics designs.
Optimise the Power Processing Unit design for coupling with      Aliena’s family of Hall effect thrusters. Understand the interactions      between power electronics and plasma devices (internal training provided).
Cooperate with embedded system engineers to improve the Electronic      Control Unit and explore the possibility of an integrated ECU-PPU.
Support the design of laboratory experiments to test the PPU      performance coupled with different Thruster Units and power rails.
Assist in the environmental testing of PPUs and other Aliena      systems (might involve travelling abroad).
Partner with the operations team in planning for the scale production      stage of the propulsion system.
Document and share best-practices.


Qualifications

Degree in Electrical Engineering or related technical discipline.
Experience in PCB design and assembly including knowledge of eCAD.

Useful experiences
· Experience in modelling, simulating, and testing of power electronics through tools like PSIM, MATLAB, ORCAD/PSPICE, LTspice, etc..
· Experience in designing and solving technical problems in the area of power and analog circuit design.

If you are not ticking all of the abovementioned qualifications, don’t you worry! We are looking forward to helping you accomplish them together with us!

Ideal profile

Motivated self sufficient individual, aiming to improve itself as      well as the company
Hands-on approach
Out-of-the-box problem solver
Team player


What we offer

Market competitive compensation
Personal office computer
Dynamic and inclusive work environment
Comprehensive health coverage
Options under the Employee Stock Option Plan


***Admin note***
Only shortlisted candidates would be contacted directly by Aliena's HR for interviews and further assessment
Job Description:
Job Description: 
Perform the electrical design, simulation and analysis of power      electronics circuits and systems to meet technical product requirements.      The main focus will be on DC-DC power converters.
Conduct the electrical debug, test, characterization, and      validation of power electronics designs.
Optimise the Power Processing Unit design for coupling with      Aliena’s family of Hall effect thrusters. Understand the interactions      between power electronics and plasma devices (internal training provided).
Cooperate with embedded system engineers to improve the Electronic      Control Unit and explore the possibility of an integrated ECU-PPU.
Support the design of laboratory experiments to test the PPU      performance coupled with different Thruster Units and power rails.

title: Investment Advisor/ Specialist
description:
About Us:
At Apex Life, we are dedicated to helping our clients achieve their financial goals through expert financial advice and investment strategies. We pride ourselves on our commitment to integrity, professionalism, and client success. As we continue to expand our services, we are seeking a knowledgeable and client-focused Investment Advisor to join our team and provide personalized financial guidance.

Job Overview:
We are looking for Investment Advisor who is passionate about finance, investments, and helping individuals and businesses plan for their financial future. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical and interpersonal skills, providing tailored financial advice to clients. If you are a motivated and client-oriented financial professional who thrives on building lasting client relationships, we want to hear from you.

Job Responsibilities:

Client Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with clients, understanding their financial goals, risk tolerance, and investment preferences.
Financial Planning: Assess clients' financial situations, develop comprehensive financial plans, and provide personalized investment strategies to help clients achieve their objectives.
Portfolio Management: Create and manage investment portfolios, monitoring performance and making adjustments to align with clients' goals and market conditions.
Investment Research: Conduct in-depth research and analysis of investment options, staying informed about market trends and financial products to make informed recommendations.
Risk Management: Assess and manage investment risks, ensuring clients' portfolios align with their risk tolerance and objectives.
Client Education: Educate clients on various investment options, financial strategies, and market dynamics, empowering them to make informed decisions.
Compliance: Adhere to regulatory guidelines and industry standards while providing financial advice and managing client portfolios.
Client Acquisitions: Expand the client base through effective networking, referrals, and business development efforts.


Qualifications:

Minimum age of 21 years old, holding a diploma
Strong knowledge of financial markets, investment products, and financial planning. (No experience is okay, training provided)
Excellent analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Client-focused with a commitment to delivering exceptional service.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.
Up-to-date knowledge of financial regulations and compliance standards.


We look forward to welcoming you to our team and helping clients build a brighter financial future.

title: Graduate Piping Engineer
description:
Technical Responsibilities

Delivers pipe stress and other miscellaneous calculations efficiently and effectively manages multiple tasks independently and in a multi-disciplinary team. 
Utilises CAESAR II and AutoPIPE engineering software as well as company proprietary Microsoft Excel spreadsheets as required. Conversant with relevant International Codes of Practice as well as engineering and industry standards
Provide necessary sketches and guidance to piping designers or drafting team and verify that Piping requirements are reflected in the design. Ensure output is completed on time, on budget, and exceeding quality standards
Assists in preparation of datasheets and checking of piping material take off
Assists in design reviews and participate in other discipline reviews if required. Ensures incorporation of all Piping-related review comments. Detailed review of drawings for scope and presentation, including checking for technical accuracy and adherence to company standards
Establishes and maintains effective working relationships internally. Engages with inter-discipline community and promotes networking and knowledge sharing

Job Requirements

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent Engineering Specialisation from an accredited university
1+ years professional engineering in the related field. Fresh Graduates are strongly welcomed to apply.
Excellent technical communication (oral and written) skills with proven ability to present technical issues to design teams and project engineering teams
Self-starter and be able to work with minimal supervision, make sound decisions, take independent action, analyze problems, and provide focused solutions to assigned projects
Possess strong inter-personal and communication skills and be able to work well with people at all levels
Job Description:
Job Description: 
Delivers pipe stress and other miscellaneous calculations efficiently and effectively manages multiple tasks independently and in a multi-disciplinary team. 
Utilises CAESAR II and AutoPIPE engineering software as well as company proprietary Microsoft Excel spreadsheets as required. Conversant with relevant International Codes of Practice as well as engineering and industry standards
Provide necessary sketches and guidance to piping designers or drafting team and verify that Piping requirements are reflected in the design. Ensure output is completed on time, on budget, and exceeding quality standards
Assists in preparation of datasheets and checking of piping material take off
Assists in design reviews and participate in other discipline reviews if required. Ensures incorporation of all Piping-related review comments. Detailed review of drawings for scope and presentation, including checking for technical accuracy and adherence to company standards
Establishes and maintains effective working relationships internally. Engages with inter-discipline community and promotes networking and knowledge sharing

Job Requirements: 
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent Engineering Specialisation from an accredited university
1+ years professional engineering in the related field. Fresh Graduates are strongly welcomed to apply.
Excellent technical communication (oral and written) skills with proven ability to present technical issues to design teams and project engineering teams
Self-starter and be able to work with minimal supervision, make sound decisions, take independent action, analyze problems, and provide focused solutions to assigned projects
Possess strong inter-personal and communication skills and be able to work well with people at all levels

title: Web Developer & Full-Stack Coding Intern
description:
Quick Apply: You may send your Resume/CV to recruitment@singaporetuitionteachers.com or apply via MyCareersFuture.
Office Location: 28 Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Bright Hill/Marymount/Bishan MRT)
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:

MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture

Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:

Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.

Learning Outcomes & Objectives:

Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary

Requirements:

Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently

Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:

5 Days Work Week, Weekdays 9.00am - 6.30pm
Midview City (Sin Ming Lane)
Closest MRTs: Bright-Hill MRT (Door-Step), Bishan / Marymount MRT (nearby)
$1,000 - $1,200/Month
Interns will also be given several days of paid leave (depending on internship period)

Why Choose Us:

Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics!
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
Conveniently located with New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep

Application:

Submit an e-mail application with Resume/CV to mindflex.recruitment@gmail.com with Email Title "Web Developer Intern Application"
Please ensure to include the following in Email and attached documents:

1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Suitable Profile Picture of Yourself
4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement
Others:

Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face
Signing of Non-Compete contract will be required upon successful selection

Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.

title: Sample Coordinator [ BioA ]
description:
Job Level & compensation offered may vary depending on candidates’ experiences and competencies. 

As the sample coordinator, responsible for the entry and tracking of standards, blank matrix and samples, which are managed through the electronic sample management system. Performs a variety of sample accession responsibilities in compliance with appropriate SOPs and regulatory guidelines, in support of departmental operations.

Responsibilities:

Performs any combination of sample accession tasks, including opening, entering, tracking, labeling, shipping and disposition of samples.  Reviews sample inventory against samples to ensure accuracy and communicate discrepancies.  Communicates confirmation of sample receipt to clients, if appropriate.  Distributes sample information and paperwork.
Site Administrator for Nautilus and Dial M.
Solves problems independently, contacting internal or external clients for clarification as needed.
Handles internal and external customer inquiries and requests
Approved as an authorized environmental system monitor and after hours responder.  Assists in maintaining the logbooks, if appropriate, for the department and ensures accuracy of information they contain.
Certified to be an “after hours sample receipt” team member, as appropriate.
Participates on teams and committees representing the sample management group.
Participates in client visits as needed, assists in communicating technical information.
Assist Management with responding to QAU, client and regulatory questions.
Work with procurement to order lab supply for the studies.
Maintains a clean and safe laboratory work environment.
Participates in process improvement initiatives.
May perform routine instrument calibration and maintenance.
May assists in writing text for SOP, protocols, methods or reports.
Contributes towards a cohesive team environment.
Introduces and develops improvement ideas for the group, working with management.
Performs other related duties as assigned.

Requirements :

Min. 2- 3 years related or relevant laboratory experience required with a Bachelor of Science/Arts (BS/BA) degree in chemistry or related scientific field
Experience may be substituted for education.
Ability to perform basic computer skills (e.g., Word, Excel).
Familiar with the use of standard laboratory equipment (e.g., balances, pipettes, centrifuges).
Experience with analytical instrumentation is desired.
Independently conduct tests for chemistry projects and provide initial analysis of results, asking questions as needed.
Acts as a technical resource for the department (trouble shooting, method development, qualification, maintenance and training) with guidance as needed.
Maintains and operates laboratory equipment, including independent problem identification and resolution.
Evaluates data for incorporation into written reports.
Completes project assignments on time with supervision.
Knowledgeable on a variety of study types, analysis procedures and methodology.
Able to effectively communicate, both verbally and in writing.
Job Description:
Job Description: 
Performs any combination of sample accession tasks, including opening, entering, tracking, labeling, shipping and disposition of samples.  Reviews sample inventory against samples to ensure accuracy and communicate discrepancies.  Communicates confirmation of sample receipt to clients, if appropriate.  Distributes sample information and paperwork.
Site Administrator for Nautilus and Dial M.
Solves problems independently, contacting internal or external clients for clarification as needed.
Handles internal and external customer inquiries and requests
Approved as an authorized environmental system monitor and after hours responder.  Assists in maintaining the logbooks, if appropriate, for the department and ensures accuracy of information they contain.
Certified to be an “after hours sample receipt” team member, as appropriate.
Participates on teams and committees representing the sample management group.
Participates in client visits as needed, assists in communicating technical information.
Assist Management with responding to QAU, client and regulatory questions.
Work with procurement to order lab supply for the studies.
Maintains a clean and safe laboratory work environment.
Participates in process improvement initiatives.
May perform routine instrument calibration and maintenance.
May assists in writing text for SOP, protocols, methods or reports.
Contributes towards a cohesive team environment.
Introduces and develops improvement ideas for the group, working with management.
Performs other related duties as assigned.

Job Requirements: 
Min. 2- 3 years related or relevant laboratory experience required with a Bachelor of Science/Arts (BS/BA) degree in chemistry or related scientific field
Experience may be substituted for education.
Ability to perform basic computer skills (e.g., Word, Excel).
Familiar with the use of standard laboratory equipment (e.g., balances, pipettes, centrifuges).
Experience with analytical instrumentation is desired.
Independently conduct tests for chemistry projects and provide initial analysis of results, asking questions as needed.
Acts as a technical resource for the department (trouble shooting, method development, qualification, maintenance and training) with guidance as needed.
Maintains and operates laboratory equipment, including independent problem identification and resolution.
Evaluates data for incorporation into written reports.
Completes project assignments on time with supervision.
Knowledgeable on a variety of study types, analysis procedures and methodology.
Able to effectively communicate, both verbally and in writing.

title: Production Operator
description:
Job Description

Cut big slabs to size by operating bridge-cutting machines.
Operate profiling/polishing machines.
Cut and polish sink holes to templates.
Grind and polish edges with portable power tools.
Color match various types of resin glues to match stones.
Seal natural stones such as Granite after fabrication.
Self-inspect work upon completion.
Cleaning of equipment and workstation after work.
Work closely with co-workers, leaders and Production Supervisor to fulfil all job requirements, production and quality standards.


Job Requirements

Physically fit and able to carry heavy weight items.
Able to do basic mathematical calculations.
Able to work in and adjust to varying production timelines.
Able to work as a team player and willing to learn.
Possess craftsman ability to use portable power tools and hand tools to cut, grind, shape, and polish      various types of stone products.
Experience with proper and safe use of tools utilized in fabrication preferred.
Can read and work from drawings and diagrams created manually or from a CAD program.
Prior experience with CNC machines will be an advantage.
Basic knowledge and prior experience of stone surfaces will be an advantage.
Working knowledge of the use of different products and solvents such as various types of adhesive glues, acetone, and denatured alcohol used for fabrication will be an advantage.

title: Workshop Instructor Assistant (Urban Farming)
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Since October 2011, Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities (THKMC) was incorporated as a charity with an IPC status to provide multiple social and welfare services to the community at large.
THKMC provides assistance to the various groups in our community through more than 60 programmes and services for the elderly and the sick, families, persons with disabilities, and children.  We help anyone in need with full respect to their race, colour, creed, language, culture and religion. We have more than 90 programmes and services, reaching out to more than 55,000 people in the community.
Together, as ONETHK – Empowering the Community.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Trainees’ management - learning, training and behaviour management
Assist Workshop Instructor to: -
Teach, train and supervise trainees
Perform planting tasks (seeding movement, transplanting and harvesting)
Process and pack finished products
Groom and maintain crops in a designated space
Check production parameters prior to the start of each process
Maintain checklists and records pertaining to production, plant health and irrigation systems
Clean and reinstate workstations

Ensure proper hygiene practices in accordance with food safety and hygiene standards
Implement and practise behaviour strategies with trainees
Other duties assigned by the manager and instructors
Programme development 
Prepare and conduct skill training programmes 
Prepare and conduct prevocational lessons
Assist in the research, development, and production of training materials
Work with trainees and caregivers to achieve suitable employment outcomes
Administration & Operation
Routine admin duties
Document client progress and work with multidisciplinary team for interventions and reviews 
Contribute to case reviews 
Other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS
• GCE O Level or NITEC Certificate
OTHER INFORMATION
Able to work independently with minimum supervision.
Pleasant personality, possess initiative and is a team player.
Passionate about making a difference to improve the lives of others in the community.
Must be able to converse in simple English.
Have a compassionate and patient personality.
Experience in working with persons with special needs is an added advantage.
On the job training will be provided.

    Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities

title: Web Developer & Full-Stack Coding Intern
description:
Quick Apply: You may send your Resume/CV to recruitment@singaporetuitionteachers.com or apply via MyCareersFuture.
Office Location: 28 Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Bright Hill/Marymount/Bishan MRT)
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:

MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture

Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:

Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.

Learning Outcomes & Objectives:

Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary

Requirements:

Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently

Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:

5 Days Work Week, Weekdays 9.00am - 6.30pm
Midview City (Sin Ming Lane)
Closest MRTs: Bright-Hill MRT (Door-Step), Bishan / Marymount MRT (nearby)
$1,000 - $1,200/Month
Interns will also be given several days of paid leave (depending on internship period)

Why Choose Us:

Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics!
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
Conveniently located with New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep

Application:

Submit an e-mail application with Resume/CV to mindflex.recruitment@gmail.com with Email Title "Web Developer Intern Application"
Please ensure to include the following in Email and attached documents:

1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Suitable Profile Picture of Yourself
4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement
Others:

Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face
Signing of Non-Compete contract will be required upon successful selection

description:

Salary: $1800 - $2200 + Commission + Allowance (Total Earnings: $2800 and above) 薪水：$1800 - $2200 + 佣金 + 津贴（总收入：$2800及以上）

Are you passionate about the beauty, massage, and wellness industry? Do you have excellent communication skills and a friendly disposition? Our client, a Beauty Massage Wellness spa located in Chinese Garden, Singapore, is seeking a Spa Receptionist to be a welcoming and vital part of their team.
如果您对美容、按摩和健康产业充满激情，拥有出色的沟通技巧和友好的性格，我们的客户，一家位于新加坡中国园的美容按摩养生水疗中心，正在寻找一名水疗前台接待员，以成为他们团队中受欢迎的重要成员。

Greet and welcome spa guests with warmth and professionalism. 用热情和专业精神迎接和欢迎水疗客人。
Provide information about spa services, packages, and promotions to guests. 向客人提供关于水疗服务、套餐和促销活动的信息。

Promote spa products and services to enhance guest experience. 推广水疗产品和服务，以提升客人体验。

Fluent in Mandarin and comfortable speaking and translating with Chinese counterparts. 流利的普通话，能够与中国同事进行流畅交流和翻译。
Willing to work during weekends. 愿意在周末工作。

If you are customer-oriented, have a passion for wellness, and enjoy creating a positive and welcoming environment for spa guests, we would love to hear from you. Join our client's spa team and embark on a rewarding career in the beauty and wellness industry. Apply now and be part of a team that values your dedication and contribution to their success.

All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:

Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.

Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.

Learning Outcomes & Objectives:

Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary

Requirements:

Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently

Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us

title: Data Analyst (Banking/Central/Up to $5500)
description:
Data Analyst (Banking/Central/Up to $5500)

Job Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in shaping our data-driven decision-making processes. Your primary responsibilities will include:

Feature Creation: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and enrich reusable assets, contributing to the enhancement of our data resources and analytical capabilities.
Ad Hoc Analysis: Generate on-demand analysis and insights, providing key stakeholders with actionable information for decision-making.
Script Development: Build and maintain program scripts to automate data processes, ensuring data integrity and efficiency in data operations.
Analytics Tools: Utilize a variety of analytics tools and platforms, including SQL, Python, Sparks, and more, to manipulate and extract insights from complex datasets.
Statistical Analysis: Apply basic proficiency in statistical analysis, data mining, and machine learning techniques to uncover patterns, trends, and opportunities within data.
Data Management: Work with large-scale datasets, ensuring data quality, organization, and effective storage.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.) with 1-3 years of working experience, fresh graduates are welcomed to apply.
Proven experience working with SQL, Python, Sparks, and other relevant analytics tools.
Basic proficiency in statistical analysis, data mining, and machine learning concepts.
Strong problem-solving skills and an analytical mindset.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex data findings to non-technical stakeholders.
A passion for staying up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in data analytics.

title: Office Secretary
description:
Responsibilities:

Provide comprehensive administrative support including managing schedules, handling calls, and organizing meetings.
Draft, edit, and proofread various forms of correspondence (emails, letters, memos).
Maintain organized physical and electronic files for easy accessibility.
Coordinate appointments, meetings, and events for office staff.
Act as a liaison between the office and clients, vendors, and stakeholders.
Handle travel arrangements for employees including flights, accommodations, and transportation.
Maintain accurate records and databases.
Ensure office space is organized and supplies are well-stocked.

Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
Exceptional organizational abilities with attention to detail.

Ability to adapt to changing priorities in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving skills and ability to address administrative issues.
Professionalism in interactions with clients and colleagues.
Discretion and ability to handle sensitive information.
Team player with excellent time management skills.

title: Fund Investment Analyst (Research and analysis, Japanese-speaking)
description:
• Location: Raffles Place
• Working hours: 09:30 to 17:30 (Monday to Friday)
• Salary: up to $8,000 (depending on experience)

Fund Investment Analyst (Research and analysis, Japanese-speaking)

Our client is a local family office with Headquarters in China, that is expanding its operations in Singapore and looking for a Fund Investment Analyst covering Japan Fund assets.

Job Description:

Conduct ground research to apply a macro view on different markets, and fundamental research to potential sectors
Working with the team Director for assets mapping and classification
Conduct routine updates for existing portfolio funds by return contribution analysis, risk shifting check, and periodical strategy review
Conduct due diligence on pipeline funds by historical performance analysis, peer comparison, GP interviews, and reference checks.
Collaborate with colleagues globally


Job Requirements:

To cover Japanese Fund assets and fundamental research, the business-level of Japanese is required to communicate with Japanese-speaking counterparts.
To liaise with Mandarin-speaking counterparts in China and other global branches, fluent in English and a working level of Chinese (Mandarin) is required
Highly motivated, confident self-starter, and calculated risk-taker with the ability to work independently and with others
Demonstrated ability to conduct thematic research across a broad spectrum of topics which can be additive to the investment process
Work requires traveling between Singapore and Japan

title: Web Developer Intern
description:
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:

MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture

Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:

Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.

Learning Outcomes & Objectives:

Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary

Requirements:

Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently

Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:

5 Days Work Week, Weekdays 9.00am - 6.30pm
Midview City (Sin Ming Lane)
Closest MRTs: Bright-Hill MRT (Door-Step), Bishan / Marymount MRT (nearby)
$1,000 - $1,200/Month
Interns will also be given several days of paid leave (depending on internship period)

Why Choose Us:

Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics!
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
Conveniently located with New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep

Application:

Submit an e-mail application with Resume/CV to mindflex.recruitment@gmail.com with Email Title "Web Developer Intern Application"
Please ensure to include the following in Email and attached documents:

1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Suitable Profile Picture of Yourself
4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement
Others:

Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face
Signing of Non-Compete contract will be required upon successful selection

Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application

title: Clinic Assistant
description:
Duties & Responsibilities
Front Desk

Managing the front desk including answering inquiries via phone/email/walk-ins, scheduling of appointments and patient registration
Maintaining accurate patient records, including relevant medical history

Maintaining rapport with patients

description:

Office Location: 28 Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Bright Hill/Marymount/Bishan MRT)
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:

MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture

Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:

Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.

Learning Outcomes & Objectives:

Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary

Requirements:

Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently

Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:

5 Days Work Week, Weekdays 9.00am - 6.30pm
Midview City (Sin Ming Lane)
Closest MRTs: Bright-Hill MRT (Door-Step), Bishan / Marymount MRT (nearby)
$1,000 - $1,200/Month
Interns will also be given several days of paid leave (depending on internship period)

Why Choose Us:

Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics!
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
Conveniently located with New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep

Application:

Submit an e-mail application with Resume/CV to mindflex.recruitment@gmail.com with Email Title "Web Developer Intern Application"
Please ensure to include the following in Email and attached documents:

1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Suitable Profile Picture of Yourself
4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement
Others:

Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face
Signing of Non-Compete contract will be required upon successful selection

title: Equipment Engineer (Semicon Tools / Mechanical-related / MNC)
description:
Responsibilities:

Sustain equipment KPI and make continuous improvements to enhance performance with cost maintenance.
Monitor and control equipment performance indices. Optimize PM procedures to make them more effective and efficient.
Manage the logistics for parts so as to prevent prolonged uptime losses in the case of equipment failure.
Plan and implement an effective Preventive Maintenance program on equipment.
Document Corrective Action and Best Known Methods, and Fan it out to all for maximum ROI and learning.
Coordinate new equipment start-up to support production, from facilities hook up, and vendor starts up, to acceptance of equipment for production.
Monitor and analyze SPC, JMP for data collection.


Requirements:

Degree in Mechanical / Mechatronics / E&E Engineering.
Minimum 3 years of working experience in troubleshooting/maintenance of tools in Semiconductor industry.
Proficient with SPC, FMEA, DOE, etc.
Cleanroom experience.
Good verbal and written communication skills and team player.


We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Junior Customer success
description:
Job Title: Junior Customer Success Officer
Location: Singapore
Position Type: Full-Time or Part-Time
Company Overview:
Captain's Eye is a dynamic and innovative company to provide AI on CCTV in the maritime indestry. We are dedicated to delivering exceptional solutions to our valued customers. We are seeking a highly motivated and adaptable Junior Customer Success Officer to join our team. This is a fantastic opportunity for an individual who is passionate about customer satisfaction and is eager to kickstart their career in the customer success field.

Job Description:
Role Overview:
As a Junior Customer Success Officer, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring our customers' success and satisfaction. Your primary responsibilities will revolve around written communication and engagement with our customers through emails. No prior knowledge or experience is required for this position; however, we are looking for individuals who possess excellent written communication skills, problem-solving abilities, initiative, and strong interpersonal skills.

Key Responsibilities:

Written Communication: Craft engaging and personalized emails to effectively communicate with our customers, addressing their needs, inquiries, and concerns. Ensure clarity, professionalism, and empathy in all written interactions.
Customer Engagement: Proactively reach out to customers via email to encourage their engagement with our system, guiding them through various processes, and promoting the value of our products and services.
Problem Solving: Demonstrate a keen problem-solving mindset to resolve customer issues promptly and effectively. Escalate complex problems to senior team members when necessary.
Initiative: Take initiative to identify opportunities for improvement in customer satisfaction and suggest innovative solutions to enhance our customer success strategies.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather insights on customer needs, feedback, and product enhancements. Act as a bridge between customers and the company, providing valuable feedback to improve our offerings.
Documentation: Maintain accurate and detailed records of customer interactions, ensuring that customer profiles and information are up-to-date in our CRM system.

Qualifications:

Strong written communication skills in English.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and the ability to think critically.
Proactive and self-motivated with a strong sense of initiative.
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
High school diploma or equivalent (Bachelor's degree is a plus but not required).
No prior customer success experience required; training will be provided.

title: Therapy Assistant, Rehabilitation Services
description:
The Therapy Assistant is responsible to assist the therapist in the supervision of patients and treatment implementation.

​Duties and Responsibilities

Assist the therapist by supervising and setting up equipment for patients during therapy
Assist the therapist in the treatment implement by recording and keying of daily patient statistics as well as services
Transport the ward patients when required
Check and update inventory
Clean and maintain therapy equipment as well as devices by ensuring that the equipment / aids are kept properly after use
Ensure that the proper maintenance and filing of referral forms
Adhere to all safety measures, infection control procedures involving patients, staff and the environment
Carry out any other duties as assigned by management or supervisors

Requirements

Candidate must possess at least a WSQ Higher Certificate in Healthcare Support (Therapy Support) or equivalent and has undergone the clinical attachment assessments as part of the course requirements.
Possess at least 1 year(s) of working experience in the related field is preferred and entry level candidates are welcome to apply.

*Please be informed that only applications submitted through NHG Career Webpage (corp.nhg.com.sg/Careers), WHC Career Webpage (whc.sg/joinus), JobStreet Singapore (jobstreet.com.sg), Singapore Medical Association (sma.org.sg), Singapore Nurses Association (sna.org.sg), MyCareersFuture.sg, LinkedIn and WHC appointed recruitment agencies will be considered. If you are accessing this job posting from another recruitment channel, please visit the official channels mentioned above.

title: Web Developer & Full-Stack Coding Intern
description:
Quick Apply: You may send your Resume/CV to recruitment@singaporetuitionteachers.com or apply via MyCareersFuture.
Office Location: 28 Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Bright Hill/Marymount/Bishan MRT)
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:

MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture

Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:

Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.

Learning Outcomes & Objectives:

Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary

Requirements:

Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently

Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:

5 Days Work Week, Weekdays 9.00am - 6.30pm
Midview City (Sin Ming Lane)
Closest MRTs: Bright-Hill MRT (Door-Step), Bishan / Marymount MRT (nearby)
$1,000 - $1,200/Month
Interns will also be given several days of paid leave (depending on internship period)

Why Choose Us:

Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics!
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
Conveniently located with New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep

Application:

Submit an e-mail application with Resume/CV to mindflex.recruitment@gmail.com with Email Title "Web Developer Intern Application"
Please ensure to include the following in Email and attached documents:

1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Suitable Profile Picture of Yourself
4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement
Others:

Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face
Signing of Non-Compete contract will be required upon successful selection

title: Therapy Assistant
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Since October 2011, Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities (THKMC) was incorporated as a charity with an IPC status to provide multiple social and welfare services to the community at large.
THKMC provides assistance to the various groups in our community through more than 60 programmes and services for the elderly and the sick, families, persons with disabilities, and children.  We help anyone in need with full respect to their race, colour, creed, language, culture and religion. We have more than 90 programmes and services, reaching out to more than 55,000 people in the community.
Together, as ONE THKMC – Empowering the Community.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform any other ad-hoc duties assigned

Minimum O Level in any disciplines
Carry out assigned task independently with minimal supervision
Positive working attitude with initiative
Willing to travel

title: Communications Executive (12 Months)
description:
Communications Executive - 12 Months Contract

About the Job
The Communications team is looking to engage a professional, who’s bursting with creative ideas and enthusiasm, to support us in upcoming projects that help enhance our brand in Singapore and throughout the Asia region. The person will work closely with the Communications team and with other business functions to communicate across multiple channels (internal, external, social) on a diverse array of topics. This is a great opportunity to be exposed to a wide variety of communications activities, from writing to content generation, video production and editing, design to events management.
Key Responsibilities:

Writing and other content generation: internal articles, social media posts, short-form articles
Pre-event and on-ground support at events, including exhibitions, trade shows, conferences and internal events
Design work for posters, other collateral
Creating simple video and digital content, including filming and editing
Maintain and enhance current Thales GTS intranet site
Administrative support for the Communications Department
Work closely with Communications and HR on employer branding-related projects
Work closely with communicators, project teams and press team to ensure timely communications on business news and achievements

Key requirements:

University degree or equivalent experience with specialty in Communications, Marketing, International Trades, Government Relationships, Multimedia, Journalism, or Business Administration
1+ years of experience in Communications, public relations, journalism or related field
Strong written and verbal communications skills – due to the international nature of the business, must be comfortable in writing in English; and be able to understand and operate comfortably in an international business environment.
Experience organizing and executing employee events
Proficient in digital communication tools and formats (video, podcasts, events, social media, Microsoft Suite, Adobe Suite)
Creative thinking and problem-solving skills
Enthusiastic and proactive, with a can-do attitude.
Interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with diverse stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Ability to work under tight deadlines and manage multiple projects
