title: R&D Software Engineer
description:
About Keysight:
Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world’s visionaries and innovators in electronic design, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~14,000 employees create world-class solutions in wireless communications, 5G, automotive, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries.
We’re recognized as a Great Place to Work across the globe due to our robust culture and dynamic working environment. Our global team acts as “One Keysight,” using collaboration, inclusivity, and integrity to advance technology. We’re driven and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our strong culture extends far beyond our own walls. We leverage our corporate social responsibility framework to support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability. Our technical solutions – and our methods for creating them – help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.
About the Job:
As an engineer in our R&D hardware design team, you will collaborate with manufacturing and engineering teams to design and implement Keysight’s state of the art measurement and calibration procedures and perform analyses to set specifications for all new products during development.  You will have engineering responsibility for the product design as it is released into production and beyond.  This is your opportunity to join a team that's bringing new products and technologies to the market faster and more efficiently than ever before!
About the Team:
Our R&D teams are multi-disciplinary, involving electrical, software, and mechanical engineers. You will be part of a product development team that collaborates closely with cross functional teams to design, develop, and test our new electronic circuit cards and maintain existing products for measurement in ICT platform.
Responsibilities:

Design  digital circuits, including schematic design and PCB layout, based on requirements and specifications.
Collaborate  with a team to test, validate, and debug the PCBA boards.
Develop  and implement calibration algorithms for accurate performance.
Characterize  and evaluate the performance of the digital circuit designs throughout  various stages, from initial builds to production release.
Design FPGA firmware and test benches and implement it to real product.
Design and modify test stations, analyze test data, and provide recommendations for product specifications.
Create comprehensive technical documentation for the FPGA and digital circuit designs.
Review, evaluate, and participate in setting production line specifications based on statistical data analysis.
Work on the transition of products and manufacturing processes into production and provide support throughout the entire product life cycle.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor or Master degree, major in electronic engineering, or computer engineering, or equivalent.
Proficiency  in digital circuit design, including schematic drawing and simulation.
Able to read and understand electrical schematics, technical drawings, datasheets, and written work instructions.
Knowledge of selecting and utilizing components such as resistor, capacitor, SRAM,      DDR, flash memory, ADC/DAC, MOSFETs, MCUs, CPUs, and FPGA/CPLD devices, etc.
Good organizational skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.
Hands-on experience with lab-based debugging tools, such as multi-meter, oscilloscope and solder iron.
Self-motivated and capable of working independently while following high-level objectives.
Demonstrated analytical problem-solving skills and excellent communication abilities.
Familiarity with coding, synthesizing, and simulating Verilog and VHDL RTL      implementations in FPGA and CPLD.

Desired Qualifications:

Knowledge of general communication protocols, such as I2C, SPI, JTAG, UART.
Experience  with design using VHDL and Xilinx FPGA (Series 7) would be advantageous.
Understanding  of hardware, firmware, and software/hardware interactions is highly desired.

title: Healthcare Assistant (St Andrew's Senior Care - Dover)
description:
Job Summary
Provide day care services to the clients attending the Day Care and Dementia Care Centre, by assisting in their personal care and activities of daily living to ensure comfort and safety of the individual in accordance with the standards of St. Andrew’s Senior Care, and maintaining a clean, orderly and safe environment for the clients.

Job Description

Porter clients (between drop-off point and centre, to and fro the gym for rehabilitation session).
Help clients settle down upon arrival at the centre.
See to the dietary needs of clients by serving meals to them and supervising their consumption.
Supervise and/or assist clients in the various activities· Assist clients who are require minimal supervision during toileting.
Assist clients to settle down for a nap after lunch.
Assist in the mobility of clients.

title: Contact Centre Representative (Banking Operations)
description:
Job Summary:
The Banking Operations Contact Centre Representative plays a crucial role in delivering exceptional customer service and support for our banking operations. This position involves handling customer inquiries, resolving issues, and providing information on various banking products and services. The ideal candidate should have excellent communication skills, a strong understanding of banking operations, and the ability to handle customer requests efficiently and professionally.

Key Responsibilities:

Customer Support:Handle a high volume of inbound and outbound customer calls professionally and efficiently.
Assist customers with inquiries, account information, and general banking product information.
Resolve customer issues and complaints, ensuring a high level of satisfaction.

Banking Operations Knowledge:Develop a strong understanding of the bank's products, services, policies, and procedures.
Provide accurate and up-to-date information on account balances, transaction history, and account maintenance.

Documentation and Record-Keeping:Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, including call logs, emails, and other correspondence.
Update customer account information as needed and ensure data integrity.

Problem Solving:Identify and escalate complex customer issues to the appropriate departments for resolution.
Propose solutions and alternatives to address customer concerns and requests.

Compliance and Security:Adhere to all relevant banking regulations and security protocols.
Verify customer identities and protect sensitive information.

Cross-Selling and Upselling:Identify opportunities to cross-sell or upsell banking products and services to customers.

Team Collaboration:Collaborate with colleagues to ensure a seamless customer experience.
Share feedback and insights to improve processes and service quality.


Qualifications:

Fresh Graduates or Experienced Candidates welcomed: GCE N Levels, NITEC or Higher NITEC, GCE O Level, GCE A Level, Polytechnic Diploma, University Degree.
Prior experience in a contact centre or customer service role, preferably in the banking or financial services industry.
Strong knowledge of banking operations, products, and services.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Proficient in using customer relationship management (CRM) and banking software.
Ability to remain calm under pressure and handle challenging customer interactions.
Attention to detail and strong problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of banking regulations and compliance requirements.
Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends as required.

Preferred Skills:

Sales or cross-selling experience.
Professional certification in customer service or banking.

Working Conditions:

The position involves working in a call centre environment
Weekends and Non-Weekend shifts Available: AM & PM  Shifts + Weekends / Night Shift Per Month

title: Web Developer & Full-Stack Coding Intern
description:
Quick Apply: You may send your Resume/CV to recruitment@singaporetuitionteachers.com or apply via MyCareersFuture.
Office Location: 28 Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Bright Hill/Marymount/Bishan MRT)
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:

MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture

Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:

Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.

Learning Outcomes & Objectives:

Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary

Requirements:

Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently

Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:

5 Days Work Week, Weekdays 9.00am - 6.30pm
Midview City (Sin Ming Lane)
Closest MRTs: Bright-Hill MRT (Door-Step), Bishan / Marymount MRT (nearby)
$1,000 - $1,200/Month
Interns will also be given several days of paid leave (depending on internship period)

Why Choose Us:

Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics!
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
Conveniently located with New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep

Application:

Submit an e-mail application with Resume/CV to mindflex.recruitment@gmail.com with Email Title "Web Developer Intern Application"
Please ensure to include the following in Email and attached documents:

1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Suitable Profile Picture of Yourself
4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement
Others:

Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face
Signing of Non-Compete contract will be required upon successful selection

title: Management Trainee (Partnership)
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Avocado Guild is a metaverse gaming company that aims to make a real difference by empowering and educating people around the world on blockchain gaming technology.

We are focused on building a thriving global community of players who are passionate about gaming, decentralized finance & blockchain technology. Our Web3 Gaming community is one of the largest and most passionate in the world. Avocado Guild provides a transformational economic opportunity for our community members to participate and learn in Web3.

Established in July 2021, the business has grown rapidly. Initially focused exclusively on our scholarship program for Axie Infinity, the business is now extending its scholarship model to other games and increasing its rate of investment in new partnerships and NFT assets. Profitable from day 1 of its operation, Avocado Guild’s growth has been amplified by its successful Series A raise and the launch of the Avocado DAO with the AVG token auction. 

Our Investors and Advisors represent some of the leading figures in Web 3.0.
You can learn more about Avocado Guild from these sources:-

Website: https://avocadodao.io
Interview with one of our co-founders Brendan Wong and CEO introducing Avocado Guild: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oUKKN14GgSY


ABOUT THE ROLE
We are a dynamic and agile tech startup dedicated to providing unparalleled support to blockchain companies. As pioneers in this emerging technology, we recognize the immense potential of blockchain and web3 games, and we are seeking individuals who share our passion for this cutting-edge field. This is an exceptional opportunity to be at the forefront of innovation and learning from industry leaders, well ahead of mass adoption.

The ideal candidate for this role is someone who possesses a genuine enthusiasm for blockchain technology and web3 games. We value excellent communication skills and a highly organized approach to work, as these qualities are essential for effectively collaborating with our team and clients.

At our company, we prioritize continuous growth and development. As such, the chosen candidate will have access to various opportunities for further education in web3 games and platforms. Additionally, they will have the chance to enhance their communication and management abilities through close collaboration with high-performing individuals and extensive networking opportunities.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Identify and conduct preliminary research on upcoming and promising web3 game and blockchain projects that synergizes with the organization.
Grow and maintain the organization’s partners with Play2Earn games and other protocols, including reaching out to promising projects, and deepening current long-term relationships.
Create and modify visually appealing, persuasive and effective presentations, incorporating graphs, flowcharts and infographics for internal and external stakeholders.
Study and stay up to date with all Gaming/NFT/Crypto and broader macro financial trends.
Manage inbound Partnership pipeline to ensure all requests are resolved within a timely manner
Work closely with the Partnership Team and other key business units to assist with day to day function.
Responsible for scheduling, arranging and note taking of in-person and online meetings.


REQUIREMENTS

Excellent verbal and written english communication skills to convey complex issues and nuanced considerations clearly.
Highly organized with an ability to work effectively across multiple tasks and competing priorities.
Strong passion and interest in blockchain technologies and/or gaming & NFTs
Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to identify, foster and close complex partnerships
High attention to detail and ability to critically think
Natural curiosity to learn and approach problems from a different angle
Genuine interest to develop a long-term career within the Blockchain space.


PROFICIENCY IN THE FOLLOWING TOOLS REQUIRED:

MS Office suite of products
Key social platforms including: Discord, Telegram & Signal

If you are eager to embark on an exciting journey within the realm of blockchain technology and web3 games, and you are ready to contribute your skills to a forward-thinking team, we encourage you to apply.

Join us as we shape the future of this revolutionary industry and make a lasting impact in the world of blockchain.

Key social platforms including: Discord, Telegram & Signal

title: Manufacturing Line Operator/Technician
description:
Job Description
SepPure Technologies is a CleanTech company that is revolutionizing the energy-intensive chemical
separation processes through the application of novel membrane materials and processes. If you enjoy
working in an innovative environment, we have a great opportunity for you. At SepPure Technologies,
we believe in making a positive impact on the world through sustainable technology. Our chemical resistant
nanofiltration membranes are disrupting traditional chemical separation processes, such as
distillation and evaporation, and reducing global energy use, emissions, and pollution.
Role Summary
We are seeking an experienced and skilled Production Technician to join our dynamic team. This role
is responsible for operating various tools including cutting machines, lathe machines, and other
mechanical equipment. The candidate will perform routine and preventive maintenance and ensure a
high level of safety, health, and environment in the workplace. In addition, the successful candidate
will demonstrate excellent workflow organization and meticulous cleanliness.
Responsibilities

Operate various tools and machinery for hollow fiber membrane spinning, post treatment, and assembly into nanofiltration modules.
Conduct routine and preventive maintenance of machines to ensure their functionality and longevity.
Adhere to all safety protocols and maintain a high level of safety, health, and environmental
standards in the work area.
Ensure cleanliness and proper organization in the workspace to promote efficiency and safety.
Conduct inspections and quality control checks on products to ensure they meet company standards.
Troubleshoot machine issues and perform necessary repairs.
Assist in inventory control and manage the use and replacement of equipment and tools.
Communicate effectively with the production team to ensure deadlines are met and goals areachieved.
Continually seek opportunities to improve processes and increase efficiency in production operations.

Requirements

Nitec, Higher Nitec or equivalent, technical degree or certification in a related field is preferred.
Ability to perform routine and preventive maintenance on equipment.
Candidates with experience in operating cutting machines, lathe machines, and other mechanical equipment will find role in the assembly team.
Excellent understanding of safety, health, and environmental rules and regulations.
Ability to maintain work-area cleanliness and efficient workflow.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Willingness to work in different shifts, if necessary.

Why SepPure Technologies?
Join us, and you'll be part of a dynamic, forward-thinking team committed to reducing the carbon
footprint of various industrial sectors. We offer a unique opportunity to contribute to a technology that
will define the future of industrial processes and emissions reduction.
SepPure Technologies is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are
committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We encourage applications from
candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.
To apply, please submit your CV and cover letter, detailing your relevant experience and interest in the
position. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected
for an interview will be contacted.

title: Project and Support Engineer
description:
The Opportunity
Our Mission
Technology is here for a reason – to make life easier for everyone.
At BlueBell Discovery, we are passionate about creating IT systems     that are effective, reliable and truly makes everyday life easier for     users! Thus, over the years, we have been delighting clients from a    wide  range of industries with our integrated solutions, which have    played a  key part in driving productivity improvements, enhancing    customer  experience and catalysing business growth for them. Some of    our key  products which have made life easier for clients and end users    include  our Media and Queue Systems, Self-Service Payment Systems,    Self-Service  Registration Systems etc.
Our Team
We value teamwork above individual glory, we favour ability over     experience and degrees, and as a Singapore IT company that delivers     results, we cherish a great can-do attitude over all else!
About the Role
We’re looking for a Project and Support Engineer to be the go-to     professional trusted and relied upon to provide IT system support and    to  resolve system issues.
If you are looking for:

a key role in system support;
an opportunity to learn and contribute in a challenging and dynamic environment; and
the satisfaction that comes with keeping systems in tip top condition,

read on, as this is the opportunity you’re looking for!
What You’ll Learn
At BlueBell Discovery, with the right attitude, you will have an exponential learning curve.
Some things you will learn:

Integrate equipment
Configure system and network
Diagnose system issues
Apply targeted and effective system fixes
Problem-solving skills
Communication skills
Be a better team player
Industry insights on trends and requirements

Job Description
Be a key personnel in system development and on-going usability

Co-ordinate project activities and monitor project progress
Assemble and test equipment and systems
Install and commission systems
Conduct user training
Manage and resolve issues
Conduct routine maintenance
Help clients resolve system-related issues

The job will also require the candidate to be on standby for system     support if necessary. There will be rotation for the after-office  hours    standby within the team. Should the candidate be activated  after   office  hours to provide system support, flexible working  arrangements   can be  arranged for the following day.
Requirements

Fresh graduates or experienced engineers who are constantly seeking challenges
Diploma or NITEC in any of the following: Information Technology,     Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Computer Engineering,   Mechanical   Engineering or any other related disciplines
Experience or knowledge in networking equipment configuration and design, setup and deployment
Knowledge in using AutoCAD or any 2D or 3D technical designing tool is a plus
Singaporeans and Singapore PR only

What we’re looking for in you:

Enjoy Project and Support work and are constantly seeking improvements in work processes, to make life easier for people
Possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills; able to break down a complex problem into manageable modules
Strong attention to details
Self-motivated
Able to work independently and effectively in a team
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Excellent time and project management skills

title: Operations Associate, Facilities (Residential Care)*
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

NTUC Health Co-operative Limited (NTUC Health) is an NTUC social enterprise that provides a comprehensive and integrated suite of quality and affordable health and eldercare services to meet the growing needs of families and their dependents. Building on more than four decades of experience and expertise, NTUC Health is among the largest senior day care, nursing home and home personal care providers in Singapore. It also offers other services for seniors such as an active ageing hub, senior activity centres, community support for vulnerable seniors, and a sheltered / senior group home. In addition, it runs a chain of dental clinics, and a family medicine clinic

RESPONSIBILITIES

You are responsible for the general maintenance of the home.  Ensuring home’s equipment, gadgets and instruments are maintained at optimal functioning level at all times.  Duties include maintaining a safe environment within the home such as managing visitors’ entrance and departure, ensuring safe and smooth traffic flow.
Store
Manage day to day operations in inventory management e.g. receiving of stocks, weekly distribution of supplies to wards
Assets management and labeling of assets
Update on stock level and replenishment where required
Improving productivity standards
Issuance and receiving of stocks
Create Purchase Requisition and receive Purchasing Order
Ensure orders are met and delivery are carried out in a timely manner
Any other duties assigned
Facilities
Conduct general repair and maintenance of premises and equipment
Prepare and arrange rooms in the Home for different functions
Assist in assets movement and labelling of assets
Ensure the key facilities are functional and trigger external maintenance when needed Report to the Reporting Officer of any equipment malfunction or breakdown
Man the Fire Command Centre, CCTV monitoring system, fire safety alarm system and attend to security issues, eg. activate SCDF when required
Participate as member of the Home’s Fire Safety Committee and support Operations to attend to any fire hazard

QUALIFICATIONS
At least 1 year of related experience
Good team player
Able to read and write simple English
Able to lift heavy items
Able to do shift work, inclusive of weekends and public holidays

title: Web Developer & Full-Stack Coding Intern
description:
Quick Apply: You may send your Resume/CV to recruitment@singaporetuitionteachers.com or apply via MyCareersFuture.
Office Location: 28 Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Bright Hill/Marymount/Bishan MRT)
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:

MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture

Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:

Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.

Learning Outcomes & Objectives:

Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary

Requirements:

Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently

Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:

5 Days Work Week, Weekdays 9.00am - 6.30pm
Midview City (Sin Ming Lane)
Closest MRTs: Bright-Hill MRT (Door-Step), Bishan / Marymount MRT (nearby)
$1,000 - $1,200/Month
Interns will also be given several days of paid leave (depending on internship period)

Why Choose Us:

Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics!
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
Conveniently located with New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep

Application:

Submit an e-mail application with Resume/CV to mindflex.recruitment@gmail.com with Email Title "Web Developer Intern Application"
Please ensure to include the following in Email and attached documents:

1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Suitable Profile Picture of Yourself
4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement

Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face

title: Senior/Software Engineer (Mobile Application)
description:
Responsibilities:
We are looking for Software Engineer who possesses a passion for pushing mobile technologies to the limits and will work with Creative’s engineers to design and build our mobile applications that will be the enabling software for Creative’s range of audio products. You will undertake development work on Android and iOS applications to support Creative’s audio products. You need to collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design and ship new features and support new products. You have to unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability and general reliability and robustness. You are required to adopt automated testing to improve productivity and software quality. You must work on bug fixing and improving application performance. You should continuously discover, evaluate and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.

Requirements:

Degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering or its equivalent.
Strong programming foundation in object-oriented programming/design, Java, Swift, Android and iOS development.
Experience with Agile software development methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban.
Experience with Software testing methodologies such as unit testing, black box testing, white box testing etc.
Experience with version control systems such as Subversion, Git.
Experience with Wifi/Bluetooth interface, Internet and Cloud Computing and knowledge in Unix, Linux and Macintosh OS environment is an added advantage.
Job Description:

Degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering or its equivalent.
Strong programming foundation in object-oriented programming/design, Java, Swift, Android and iOS development.
Experience with Agile software development methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban.

Experience with version control systems such as Subversion, Git.

title: Senior / Staff Nurse (2 Rotating Shifts - Centre-based)
description:
Our Client is looking for passionate Staff Nurses who wants to join the organization for an exciting renal career as a specialisation. The incumbent is required to maintain standards of patient care, the delivery of safe efficient dialysis therapy as prescribed to patients.

Job Responsibilities:

You will be a part of our nursing team providing a high standard of nursing care to our renal patients.
You will oversee and assist in the education of patients, ensure accurate nursing records are maintained and give and receive comprehensive nursing reports.
You will work closely with clinical nurse managers in all administrative aspects of centre management.
You will be assigned to one of the dialysis centres, conveniently located island-wide.

Job Requirements:

Registration with Singapore Nursing Board is a MUST
Senior Staff Nurse position must hold Advanced Diploma in any Nursing Field
Training will be provided for those without renal experiences
Our centres operate on 2 shifts from Monday to Saturday
Morning: 7.00am to 3.30pm ; Afternoon: 3.00pm to 11.30pm

description:

Office Location: 28 Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Bright Hill/Marymount/Bishan MRT)
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:

MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture

Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:

Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.

Learning Outcomes & Objectives:

Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary

Requirements:

Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently

Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:

5 Days Work Week, Weekdays 9.00am - 6.30pm
Midview City (Sin Ming Lane)
Closest MRTs: Bright-Hill MRT (Door-Step), Bishan / Marymount MRT (nearby)
$1,000 - $1,200/Month
Interns will also be given several days of paid leave (depending on internship period)

Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics!
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
Conveniently located with New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep

title: Insurance Specialist (Banking) | CODE:GL
description:
Join Our Team as an Insurance Specialist

Position Overview:
As an Insurance Specialist, you will be a vital member of our team, working closely with Relationship Managers to provide expert guidance on protection plans and insurance products to our valued clients. Your role involves conducting training sessions for Relationship Managers, performing in-depth financial analyses, and tailoring personalized insurance solutions. Your commitment to delivering excellent customer service while ensuring strict regulatory compliance makes you an essential asset to our team.

Position Details:
Key Responsibilities:

Partner with Relationship Managers to provide protection plans and product advisory to clients.
Conduct product and insurance proposition training for Relationship Managers to enhance their product knowledge.
Perform comprehensive financial analysis for clients, customizing a set of products that align with their unique needs.
Offer product advisory services to clients, delivering an excellent customer service and banking experience.
Maintain rigorous compliance with all bank regulations and external regulatory authorities.

Qualifications:

A minimum of 2 years of insurance sales experience is preferred.
At least a Diploma or Degree qualification.

This is your opportunity to be a part of a team that provides expert insurance solutions and exceptional customer experiences. If you have the qualifications and drive to excel in this role, we encourage you to apply for the position of Insurance Specialist. Your expertise and dedication are valued assets that will help us achieve our mission of providing top-tier financial services to our clients.
Interested candidates can kindly apply via MyCareersFuture or drop your latest resume to gary.lua@justrecruit.com.sg

title: IT Technician
description:
IT Block Pte Ltd is a dynamic and innovative IT services provider based in Singapore. We are seeking a motivated and skilled IT Technician to join our team. We are open to hiring ITE graduates and individuals passionate about IT. This role provides an excellent opportunity for those looking to start or advance their career in the IT industry. As an IT Technician with IT Block, you will have the chance to work with various technologies and gain valuable experience.

Responsibilities:

Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance to clients.
Install, configure, and maintain hardware and software components, including servers, laptops, and other IT equipment.
Set up and maintain firewalls and network security measures.
Perform on-site visits to client locations for installations, maintenance, and support.
Collaborate with the IT team to resolve technical issues and deliver excellent customer service.
Assist in the development of IT solutions and recommendations for clients.
Keep up-to-date with the latest IT trends and technologies.

Qualifications:

Minimum of an ITE diploma in an IT-related field. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply.
Knowledge of server and network configurations.
Basic understanding of computer hardware and software.
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.
Excellent communication and customer service skills.
Willingness to travel to client sites when necessary.

Certifications (Preferred):
While not mandatory, the following certifications are beneficial and can enhance your candidacy:

CompTIA A+
CompTIA Network+
Microsoft Certified: Azure Fundamentals
Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)
Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)

What We Offer:

Competitive starting salary with growth opportunities.
A dynamic and collaborative work environment.
Hands-on experience with a wide range of IT technologies.
Ongoing training and development opportunities.
Exposure to diverse client environments.
The chance to launch or advance your IT career.

If you're passionate about IT, enjoy solving technical challenges, and want to work with a supportive team, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us at IT Block Pte Ltd and start your journey in the IT industry.

title: Nursing Aide
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

MINDS has been caring for Persons with Intellectual Disabilities (PWIDs) and their families since 1962.
Grounded in the belief that all PWIDs have innate abilities and talents, MINDS is committed to empowering them and enhancing their quality of life, while advocating for greater inclusivity for PWIDs as a nation.
MINDS is today one of the largest charities in Singapore employing more than 850 staff. With the key focus to expand community-based services, improving the employability of PWIDS, strengthening education, and engendering inclusive community living, MINDS offers a holistic range of services and programmes across the PWIDs’ lifespan.
These include schools, employment and training development centres, home-based care services and community-based services to cater to the physical, psychological, environmental and social needs of PWIDs. For more information, please visit www.minds.org.sg.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Provide client care
Provide personal care assistance to residents in their daily living such as toileting, bathing, dressing and grooming and ensure the residents good personal hygiene at all times
Provide supervise or assistance to residents during meal times
Perform daily activities residents management according to care plans (ICP)
Prepare residents for their various activities, meal times and bed times
Assist in giving regular medication and when necessary, other medication under Staff Nurse’s supervision with proper recording
Ensure the proper records of residents as instructed. (e.g. behaviour records, daily logs, home leave records, etc)
Ensure that residents diet restrictions are adhered to
Monitor and record bowel movement, menstruation, blood pressure, weight and height of residents on a regular interval
Conduct body checks on residents on a daily basis
Support the intervention during medical emergency of residents
Maintain up-to-date documentation of clients' conditions and care treatments
Provide inputs during case review and liaise with healthcare professionals for the development and review of care plans
Verify accuracy of documentation of client's condition, progress and care treatments
Review inventory for replenishing in medical supply
Maintain order, safety and cleanliness of the care environment
Ensure client behaviours are in compliance to house rules
Respond to unusual or challenging behaviours of clients
Recommend measures to mitigate risk to clients
Support the intervention implementation for managing the challenging behaviours
Perform housekeeping duties
Ensure equipment is maintained in a clean and working condition
Manage care operations
Perform daily handover to staff during changes in shifts
Provide input to operations review meetings
Perform stakeholder engagement
Assist in liaising with other professionals, volunteer Doctor, hospital and stakeholders involved in the case to facilitate provision of care services for clients

QUALIFICATIONS
SQ Higher Certificate in Healthcare (Nursing Care)
ITE Skills Certificate in Healthcare (Home Care) Programme
Preferably 1-year relevant working experience
Computer literacy skills “ MS Word and PowerPoint
Experience working with persons with autism, intellectual and/or developmental disabilities is preferred
Able to commit 3 working shifts / 5 days work week



    Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - MINDSG LTD

Provide personal care assistance to residents in their daily living such as toileting, bathing, dressing and grooming and ensure the residents good personal hygiene at all times
Provide supervise or assistance to residents during meal times
Perform daily activities residents management according to care plans (ICP)
Prepare residents for their various activities, meal times and bed times
Assist in giving regular medication and when necessary, other medication under Staff Nurse’s supervision with proper recording

Verify accuracy of documentation of client's condition, progress and care treatments

Able to commit 3 working shifts / 5 days work week

title: Financial Fraud/Scam - Customer Service Officer (Banking Call Centre)
description:
Job  Responsibilities
·        Ensures highest standard of service  delivery to our customers.
·        Respond and react in a timely manner to  escalate fraud / scam service request.
·        Investigate transactions  flagged as suspicious timely.
·        Maintains confidentiality of the  Bank’s customers and data.
·        Identifies and resolves customer issues  and enquires received via calls platforms completely, accurately within the  committed turnaround time and in accordance with Contact  Centre  standards to ensure contact handling accuracy and operational  effectiveness
·        Educates the customer about the Bank’s products and  services and directs them toward available resources for self-help.
·         Resolves customer enquiry, request and feedback to the satisfaction of the  customer, and complete accurately the necessary documentation and subsequent  solutions.
·        Ensure group compliance & control standards are  observed and met in the execution of customers’ transaction requests
·         Uses technology and system tools as directed and within established  guidelines.
·        Ensures knowledge is up-to-date by participating in  individual and team trainings, meetings and reading the information posted in  the Contact Centre’s knowledge management  system.
·         Keeps abreast with current issues in the banking environment and competitors’  innovations.

Job Requirements
·        Degree/ Diploma in  any discipline.
·        Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply.
·         Although preferred, previous experience in Call Centre, a financial services or  Fraud setting is not essential. Our dedicated onsite Training team will provide  you with a  specifically designed training programme and  support in your new role; and to enable you to develop and provide ongoing  training for all team members.   
·        Possess a positive mindset with a  “CAN-DO” attitude a and passion to deliver quality customer service.
·         Possess a pleasant voice, excellent comprehension, communication, interpersonal  skills and work etiquette.
·        Possess good command of written and  spoken English.
·        Good analytical skills; passion for working and is  good in working with numbers.
·        Resourceful, proactive,  results-driven, attentive to details and a good team player who likes to work in  a fast-paced changing environment.
·        Passion for working, responsible  and with good working attitude.
·        Proficient in PC skills including  MS Office applications.
·        Ability to work on staggered/rotational  shifts including weekends and Public Holidays to support 24x7 Contact Centre  service operations.


Shift Options (Choose 1)

Option#1: Weekends/PHs shift  

Working Hours : 5 working days, 1 rest day and 1 off day per week
42.5 hours per week
Staggered shift hours : 8.5 working hours between 7 am to 10pm + 1-hour meal break in between
Rest Day and Off Day : Scheduled by Client (1 weekday + 1 weekend, non-consecutive) Or otherwise advised by the Client


Option #2: AM & PM Shifts + Weekends / Night

Working Hours : 5 working days, 1 rest day and 1 off day per week
42.5 hours per week
Staggered shift hours : 8.5 working hours + 1-hour meal break in between. Includes night shift.
Rest Day and Off Day : Scheduled by Client (1 weekday + 1 weekend, non-consecutive) Or otherwise advised by the Client

title: Production Technician
description:
Responsibilities:

Manage Construction Phase

Support coordination across the various disciplines and construction teams to align drawings.
Support construction plans based on contractual terms on time, cost, and quality.
Communication across disciplines and construction teams to maintain high quality assurance and control standards.
Carry out regular inspections to ensure compliance with relevant regulatory and legislative requirements, processes, and procedures.
Support supervisor on daily work activities.

Manage Project Completion and Closure

Identify all errors, defects and variations and report to supervisor for rectification.
Support the management of commissioning and testing of components, equipment, and systems.
Collate project handover and closure documents for approval and submission in compliance with the relevant regulatory and legislative requirements and maintenance.
Work with management team to close all punch list in timely manner.
Work with supervisor and manager to carry out testing and commissioning.

Production Responsibility

Responsible for achieving production KPI given by the management.
Ensure all work is carried out with highest quality and productivity standards.
Manage isotainer and storage tank in a safe manner.
Operate plant air compressor, pumps, rotary equipment etc. in a safe manner.
Carry out minor maintenance work, 5S activities and energy conservation initiatives
Able to handle forklift equipment, training will be provided
To carry out product analysis using basic lab equipment.
Conduct line pigging and equipment flushing during batch changeover and handle regular start up, shutdown and commissioning of critical process equipment.

Drive Safety and Sustainability

Comply with Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) policies and practices.
Conduct inspections to ensure compliance with organizational health and safety policies, processes, and procedures.
Report accidents and incidents in accordance with WSH policies and practices.
Follow organizational environmental sustainability and green building standards and guidelines.

Requirements

Nitec in Science or Engineering Discipline.
Able to demonstrate FIFO and 5S practices.
Entry level are welcomed to apply

title: Web Developer & Full-Stack Coding Intern
description:
Quick Apply: You may send your Resume/CV to recruitment@singaporetuitionteachers.com or apply via MyCareersFuture.
Office Location: 28 Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Bright Hill/Marymount/Bishan MRT)
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:

MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture

Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:

Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.

Learning Outcomes & Objectives:

Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary

Requirements:

Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently

Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:

5 Days Work Week, Weekdays 9.00am - 6.30pm
Midview City (Sin Ming Lane)
Closest MRTs: Bright-Hill MRT (Door-Step), Bishan / Marymount MRT (nearby)
$1,000 - $1,200/Month
Interns will also be given several days of paid leave (depending on internship period)

Why Choose Us:

Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics!
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
Conveniently located with New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep

Application:

Submit an e-mail application with Resume/CV to mindflex.recruitment@gmail.com with Email Title "Web Developer Intern Application"
Please ensure to include the following in Email and attached documents:

1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Suitable Profile Picture of Yourself
4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement
Others:

Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face
Signing of Non-Compete contract will be required upon successful selection

title: Fund Accountant Graduate
description:
To support our ongoing growth, our Langham Hall provide excellent candidates with the opportunity to learn and train in a structured environment, broad work exposure and, to progress their career quickly. They will receive study support towards their preferred accountancy qualification (e.g. CA Singapore, ACCA, CPA), mentoring and have the opportunity to work in a friendly, collaborative, social, stable and supportive environment.
Training and Qualification support:

We offer full training and support via our ‘Asia - Personal Development Programme’. This covers technical training such as in private equity and real estate funds and understanding the impact of latest accounting standards and exposure drafts applicable to clients. In addition, non-technical skill development is provided such as to include communication, effective team working and organisational skills training.
We also offer external examination support including paid exam leave, exam fee support and, practical experience mentoring) to graduates pursuing their professional accountancy qualification

Responsibilities include:

Supporting the preparation of financial statements in accordance with IFRS and U.S. GAAP and quarterly investor reporting with financial performance calculations such as multiples and IRR
Liaison with the client’s working team members
Maintenance of the full sets of accounts for the fund structure using our Private Equity implementation financial accounting system
Provide ongoing compliance support for clients including AML/KYC, FATCA and Common Reporting Standard (CRS)
Supporting the technical calculation of capital call / distribution and preparation of correspondence in accordance with the legal documents of the fund
Supporting the client during the year-end audit, including the preparation of audit schedules

Requirements:

Accounting candidates with a strong academic track and a suitable accounting focused degree
1-2 years accounting experience is helpful but not essential
Audit experience or background is welcome
Non-accounting candidates with a view to pursue professional accounting qualification will also be considered
Intention to make a career as an accountant and pursue a professional accounting qualification
A positive attitude, a sense of satisfaction from doing your best and self-discipline are all essential
Excellent written and spoken communication skills
Experience in using accounting packages for bookkeeping and report production is helpful but not essential
Microsoft Excel and Word experience, including the ability to produce neatly presented work

title: Junior Fund Accountant
description:
Company Description
Protege Fund Services is an independent Singapore based Fund Administrator. We serve a growing list of sophisticated client base ranging from individual private clients to large financial corporations.

We believe in building a long-term working relationship with our clients to create successful partnerships through customized and innovative solutions. Safeguarding our clients' privacy and confidentiality interests through robust operational processes and original solutions is our top priority.

Role Description
This is a full-time Fund Accountant role located in Singapore. Some remote work is acceptable. As a Fund Accountant, you will be responsible for the day-to-day fund accounting operations and delivery of Net-Asset-Value packs and reports to fund managers and investors.

Roles & Responsibilities

Reports to the Head of Operations
Responsibility includes supporting investor relations, fund accounting, and portfolio reporting activities
Assist with fund accounting entries of trades and cash transactions into fund accounting systems in compliance with accounting standards
Perform portfolio reconciliation with external parties
Support NAV financial closing and ensure delivery of NAV packs and reports to fund managers and investors
Support multiple asset classes and funds including both liquid and non-liquid strategies
Support fund setup process and various fund structures
Support in designing and implementing fund administration process automation initiatives to improve operational efficiencies and resiliency
Liaison with auditors to support annual audits for fund clients
Support fund related queries from fund managers

Qualifications

Good team player and possesses an excellent working attitude
Good knowledge of financial markets and financial products
Good knowledge of accounting and understanding of financial statements
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Attention to detail and time management skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field. Professional qualifications such as CPA, CFA or ACCA would be an added advantage
Fresh graduate or candidates with no direct experience will be considered for a Junior Fund Accountant role
Candidates from other industries looking for career change are welcomed to apply

title: Bancassurance Specialist (Banking) | CODE:GL
description:
Are you an aspiring professional seeking a rewarding career in the banking and financial industry? Look no further! Join our dynamic team and embark on a journey of growth and success.

Offering:

Competitive Base Salary
No Experience: Starting at $3,500 with potential to earn up to $3,900

Uncapped Sales Incentives based on Quarterly Individual Sales Performance
Exceptional Career Advancement Prospects, encompassing both Sales and Non-Sales pathways, attainable within 2-3 years. Apply now to explore further details.

Why Choose Us?
By becoming a part of our team, you will enjoy the following benefits:

Comprehensive Support from the Bank, including access to a vast client database, assigned prospects/leads, regular market updates, and product training.

Articulate, Professional, and Detail-Oriented

A minimum of a Local Diploma or higher

company_name: NATIONAL CANCER CENTRE OF SINGAPORE PTE LTD
title: Research Coordinator (Lung Cancer - Solstice)
description:
The NMRC funded inter-disciplinary lung cancer programme is seeking to employ a research coordinator to assist with study recruitment and follow-up, data collection, and biological specimen collection (and processing).

This is a multi-site lung cancer screening study that looks into screening modalities including blood based and imaging tests.

Potential candidates should be interested in the important public health challenge of reducing lung cancer mortality through early detection.

Responsibilities:

Recruitment and Enrolment

Contact participants, schedule study visit appointments and consent taking - Purpose, study procedures and participant journey to be adequately and accurately explained to volunteers
Administration of questionnaires and recording of participants' height, weight, blood pressure and baseline medical history
Collect clinical data and perform Data entry, including meticulously managing and maintaining the database
Timely follow-up with participants via email, phone, videoconferencing and/or notification letters
Tracking of health outcomes

Phlebotomy

Blood collection during study visits
Ensure that blood collection is competently and safely carried out

Lab Processing
Processing of blood samples according to laboratory protocol
Ensure that samples are properly processed and stored

Requirements:

Diploma or Degree in Nursing, Health Sciences or relevant fields with experience in research or healthcare setting
Ability to perform phlebotomy confidently
Training for processing of biological specimens will be provided (if research coordinator possess basic laboratory skills)
Computer literate, proficient in MS Office
Able to work independently and willing to be a committed team player
Meticulous with good organizational and time management skills
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Strong interest in clinical and translational research and motivated to learn

title: Production Trainee (GMP) | AMK | Up to $2,800 + AWS & Variable Bonus
description:
Job Description:

Prepare and organize materials and packaging for daily production.
Assist in the entire production process, including labeling bottles, filling, and transporting products.
Maintain cleanliness and ensure the proper condition of work areas and department equipment.
Manage comprehensive documentation, including recording, updating, issuance, and maintenance, from pre-weighing to handover to the warehouse.
Support both internal and external audits for compliance with cGMP (Current Good Manufacturing Practices).
Source raw materials, send email inquiries for quotations, and check stock availability. If raw materials are obsolete, seek alternatives and conduct pre-tests before purchasing.
Provide coaching and guidance to new employees.
Assist in generating purchase requisitions for raw materials and collaborate with management to plan production schedules based on inventory levels.
Ensure that production operators, working environments, and manufacturing processes adhere to standard operating procedures (SOP).
Collaborate within a team to ensure smooth production processes and learn the entire production operation flow, assisting employees in achieving daily output targets.
Create, update, and maintain the SAP system.
Actively participate in monthly staff meetings, providing feedback, and suggestions, and highlighting relevant issues.
Undertake other projects and assignments as instructed or delegated by management and the director.

Qualifications:

Diploma with Engineering Chemical or Chemistry background preferred.
Minimum of 2-3 years of manufacturing work experience required.
Strong independent thinker with a focus on objective decision-making and integrity.
Enthusiastic about learning and hands-on work.
Excellent communication skills for team training, coaching, and client/associate interactions.
Knowledge of ISO 14001, ISO 9001, and ISO 45001 standards is a plus.
Computer literacy is essential.

Additional Information:

Compensation: Annual Wage Supplement (AWS) and Variable Bonus.
Benefits: Medical and dental benefits provided.
Location: Conveniently situated in the Ang Mo Kio area (3 bus stops from Yio Chu Kang Interchange).
Work Schedule: 5.5 days work week.
Working Hours: Monday to Friday, 9 am to 6 pm; Saturday, 9 am to 1 pm.

title: Laboratory Assistant
Logistics Coordinator
description:
The Logistics Coordinator (Scaffold) focuses on the planning and movement of scaffold materials between sites and warehouses. Playing a critical role in maintaining the inventory of scaffold materials in the warehouse, the Logistics Coordinator will be required to liaise with all site coordinators/material controllers on their requests. Will also be required to work with Logistics Coordinator (Vehicle) on the transport arrangement and would need to work with the Scaffold Service Supervisor on the preparation of scaffold materials for delivery to the sites.

Job Responsibilities

Update and maintain inventory of scaffold materials for warehouse and job sites
Liaise with site coordinators on their forecasts and requirements and ensure that materials are ready for use based on the site’s request.
Work closely with Scaffold Service Supervisor and update him/her on what needs materials are needed urgently so that the Supervisor can make plans for the service schedule
Liaise with Logistics Coordinator (Vehicle) to arrange for the transportation of scaffold materials
Tabulate inventory and submit monthly reports to Finance

Job Requirements

Minimum NiTEC/Diploma in any field
Able to work in fast pace environment
Able to work individually and as a team
Prior knowledge of Scaffolding is an added advantage
May be required to stand in as Logistics Coordinator (Vehicle) or driver as and when required to
Assist with other roles within the Logistics Department

title: IT Executive
description:
The Write Connection is a premier education company in Singapore. We are looking for an IT Executive to support the daily operations of our centres by joining our Internal Operations Team.
Job Responsibilities

Provide daily IT support for IT-related issues and requests. This includes hardware maintenance, software application, hardware upgrades, and system installation.
Manage/participate in new setup or upgrade of systems and monitor system utilisation.
Perform troubleshooting or provide alternatives to resolve cases that are raised across various centres.
Assist with IT projects from conceptualisation, planning, execution to completion.
Ensure the deadlines of IT deliverables are met with desired quality, and communicated to various departments.
Maintain records of IT hardware, software, inventory, service and IT related contracts and documentation.
Ensure compliance with IT security policies and regulations.
Perform problem management and troubleshooting of network operating issues, desktop applications, hardware cause identification and resolution.
Perform any other special projects as assigned.
Assist with other scopes under the internal operations department.

Job Requirements

Possess at least a Diploma in IT, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Able to work efficiently to meet tight deadlines, organise time well, and work with minimum supervision.
Knowledge of Google Sheets, Google Forms, Google App Script, HTML/CSS, Apple systems and devices, and ECOS would be favourable.
Technically savvy and/or fast learner of technology.
Comfortable using the Mac platform.
Possess excellent communication skills to work with stakeholders and ensure that works meet requirements, and expected timelines.
Proficiency in spoken and written Mandarin is a plus as the work would involve collaboration with technical teams based in China

Work Hours and Location:

5 days work week: includes 4 weekdays and 1 weekend (which can be a Sat or Sun depending on roster)
Shifts: Weekdays: 12.30pm - 9.30pm , Weekends: 8.30am - 6.30pm
Work Location: TWC HQ, Guthrie House, Bukit Timah. (Candidate may be required to travel to various TWC centres)

Note to Applicant:

Only Singaporeans and PR need apply.
Send your CV to Recruitment@TheWriteConnection.com.sg

title: Project Engineer, Project Management Office
description:
Purpose & Scope
Responsible to assist the Project Manager to manage mainly site works and ensure all aspects of the site works are aligned with the project schedule, scope of work and obligations as required under the Contract.

KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Support the Project Manager on monitoring the site works progress and when necessary to expedite the site works progress to meet the project schedule
To monitor compliance to applicable company codes & standards,  safety practices, QA/QC policies and meeting performance specification during the Site Acceptance Testing (SAT)
To ensure Contractor’s site works are inline with the scope of works and update the Project Manager daily on the site works progress
To review the engineering deliverables from the Engineering team and provide feedback to the Project Manager for any corrective actions required
Work closely with the QA/QC engineer(s) to enforce the quality of works at site and are aligned with the QA/QC quality plan and other documentation such as blowing/Purging/Cleaning procedures, hydrostatic testing procedures, etc.
Work closely with the Safety Coordinator to ensure the HSE plan and associated documents such as Method Statement and Risk Assessment (MSRA) are reviewed, amended, discussed and agreed with all relevant stakeholders including the O&M team.
To ensure the Permit-to-Work (PTW) are applied in advance as per Sembcorp HSE requirements and the PTW to be issued expeditiously by O&M team for the Contractor to commence their work
To attend the weekly and monthly Engineering / Project meetings with the Project Manager for follow-up action with the Contractors
To assist the Project Manager to take minutes of meeting (MOM) during weekly/monthly engineering/project meetings and to circulate the MOM to the participants within 3 working days after clearance by the Project Manager.
Any other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

Diploma/Degrees in respective discipline Engineering (electrical or mechanical or C&I or C&S) or equivalent tertiary education
Prefer experience in petrochemical or refineries or power utilities or water industries in projects management environment.

SKILLS/COMPETENCIES & PREFERRED CHARACTERISTICS

Prefer to have software knowledge and skills in MS Office, AutoCAD and MS Project
Possesses good communication (oral) and written skills
Possess at least a Class 3 driving license for ad-hoc situations would be an advantage as the projects are located in Jurong Island.
Attended WSH courses for supervisor and obtained the certifications such as  bizSAFE Level 3 Team leader or Team Member, Work At Heights, Confined Space, Lifting Work, Radiography Testing, Excavations Works, Hot Work & Work in a Hazardous Area
Attended and obtained the WSQ Supervise Workplace Safety and Health in Process Plant [previously known as Oil / Petrochemical Industry Safety Course for Supervisor (OPISCS)] conducted by WDA-ATP or similar, equivalent external course.
Able to work independently while being a good team player.

title: Senior Engineer / Principal Engineer,  Polymer
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

REC Group is an international pioneering solar energy company dedicated to empowering consumers with clean, affordable solar power through high-quality solar panels with a leading power density. As Solar’s Most Trusted, REC is known for its patented innovations and multiple award-winning products with reliable long-term performance. The cornerstone for REC’s strong reliability is advanced and highly efficient manufacturing using Industry 4.0 practices. Founded in 1996 in Norway, REC has always been committed to a low carbon footprint in its solar materials and panels. REC is headquartered in Norway with operational headquarters in Singapore and regional hubs in North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific. As of December 2021, REC is part of Reliance Industries Limited, India’s largest private sector company with revenues of USD 104.6 billion.
Find out more at recgroup.com

RESPONSIBILITIES

We are looking for a Technology Engineer, with a keen mind and a strong interest in R&D design of solar module products. The candidate will be responsible for the improvement, evaluation and development of the encapsulations, foils and back-sheet materials as well as the processes and characterization for our next generation photovoltaic products.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Encapsulants, Foils and Back-sheet Development: Develop, test, and qualify new encapsulants and back-sheets for solar PV modules. 
Process Development: Drive quality improvement in the reliability aspects of solar PV modules. 
ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Assist R&D and process teams with technical analyses, troubleshooting and improvement projects.
Plan, coordinate and execute product enhancements to module design with external collaborators.
Drive project schedule and technical enquiries. Strategize testing/characterization methods.

QUALIFICATIONS
D. in Polymer Science/Chemical Engineering Field.
Min. 3 years relevant experience
Knowledge of PV module design functionalities.
Knowledge in characterization and analysis.
Understanding of degradation mechanism of high capacitance products.
Possess excellent project management skills, keeping track of key milestones and deliverables and providing regular updates to management team.
Knowledge of statistical data analysis methods and DOE.
Self-driven
Proactive
Analytical
Excellent team worker.
Ability to co-operate with different professionals (operations, equipment suppliers, technology institutes, supply chain, operation).
Working experience in Solar/Semiconductors/Electronics/Packaging industries is an advantage, but not necessary.
ADDITIONAL ADVANTAGEOUS SKILLS:
Product Reliability Test Design: Familiar with reliability tests, e.g. Damp-heat, Temp Cycle, Humidity Freeze, Light induced degradation, thermal shock.
Failure Analysis: Leading FA from technical part. In-depth understanding of module process – structure – property relations, and the degradation mechanism in actual application.
Creating test methodology to analyze failure samples and find out root cause.
Documenting FA report based on technical understanding.
Finite element modelling and analysis (e.g. Solidworks, ANSYS).
Documentation: Experience in documentation of experimental observations & data in publications / literature.


    Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - REC Group

Assist R&D and process teams with technical analyses, troubleshooting and improvement projects.
Plan, coordinate and execute product enhancements to module design with external collaborators.
Drive project schedule and technical enquiries. Strategize testing/characterization methods.

Min. 3 years relevant experience
